Reviews.Title: “Second time even better!”
Reviews.Author: biccabons
Reviews.Content: We came back to Hotel Andra after a stay on Orcas Island. We needed to check in early because of a hick-up in the place we had been staying in on Orcas. I called at 4:30 am and talked with a great person on the front desk (I believe it was Ben?) and he was most helpful. We got to Seattle and went directly to the hotel and there was a room waiting for us way before check-in time. The staff was friendly and helpful and the room quiet as we needed. I do believe Hotel Andra will be our go to hotel in Seattle from now on. The location is great, the staff friendly and helpful. My only pick is the lack of free internet but everything else makes up for that.

Reviews.Title: “Happy anniversary!”
Reviews.Author: sundogg99
Reviews.Content: We recently visited Seattle to celebrate our wedding anniversary. We took advantage of a deal that included free parking (normally around $40 per night) and booked a Lux Corner Suite for our stay. The hotel, advertised as being in the Belltown area, is actually kind of on the border between the downtown core and Belltown proper, which is a bit north of the core. The lobby looks exactly like the photos on the hotel website. A small thing, perhaps, but too often reality falls well short of one's expectations. The Andra is carved out of a vintage building, and the decor is a very pleasing combination of sleek modern amenities, charming early 20th century millwork, and quirky old-time floorplans. Our suite included a spacious living area with sofa, a giant picnic table-like desk, cordless phone, windows on two sides, flat screen TV, minibar and coffee maker, several lamps, and an enormous freestanding mirror. French doors led to our bedroom, which included two more full-sized casement windows, a very comfortable king size bed, a dresser, and walk-in closet. Stylish modern lighting flanked the bed, along with an alarm/iPod dock and a second cordless phone. The smallish but functional and attractive bathroom featured a glass-tiled shower stall, a vessel sink, and slate floor tiles. Across from the bath was another dressing area/walk-in closet with an electronic safe. All in all, a very comfortable and attractive space. Service at the Andra was unfailingly friendly. When we returned from an afternoon of wandering the nearby shops and bars, I noticed a flashing light signaling a message on our phone. When I retrieved the message, the receptionist simply mentioned that the hotel wanted to bring something up to our room. A few minutes later, with a knock on our door, the staff delivered nice bottle of champagne with compliments and best wishes for our anniversary – a thoughtful and welcome touch! I stay in enough hotels to appreciate the challenge of providing apparently effortless service. In addition to a great physical plant and location, the Hotel Andra has mastered the service side of their business as well, giving guests a truly hospitable experience. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Amenities”
Reviews.Author: Jared25
Reviews.Content: This was our first weekend getaway in Seattle and the Hotel Andra made our experience all the better. The service staff were more than happy to make suggestions and reservations for us at some of the best restaurants in the city and Lola had a great selection of greek infused food and a good selection of cocktails for us to have after our late dinners. Our room was beautifully designed and very clean. Our only complaint was that when you flushed the toilet it was extremely loud which made it annoying if either of us used the facilities during the night. This won't keep us from going back by any means though. Hotel Andra is one of our favorite hotels and we will visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JosephFry
Reviews.Content: We tend to book this hotel most visits to Seattle, and we'll likely stick with them. Staff is great, Lola is excellent, and the room is comfortable and clean. The room this time was oddly shaped and laid out, and frankly larger than I needed, but a minor quibble.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite Seattle Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VancouverBCVancouver
Reviews.Content: We come to Seattle frequently and always stay at the Hotel Andra. The hotel is lovely, the beds are VERY comfortable, the lighting in the rooms is excellent whether you want to read in bed or on the sofa, or work at the desk. The staff is always friendly, helpful and very knowledgeable. Another wonderful plus is it's right in the heart of "Tom Douglas land" -- Serious Pie, Dahlia Lounge, Lola right in the hotel, etc. Tom's restaurants are among the best in Seattle and we never come to town without eating at at least one of them. We love the Andra.

Reviews.Title: “Our only getaway spot in Seattle~”
Reviews.Author: daisytrip
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Hotel Andra every visit to Seattle for the past 5+ years. We absolutely love it. We've gone for anniversary trips, and also with our kids. Here are the reasons we keep coming back: Location- Easy walk to all our favorite spots Staff- Super friendly, helpful Rooms- Comfy bed, fab reading lights, ipod dock, room to stretch out and relax Food- LOVE Lola at Breakfast, warm pita and dips and greek salad at lunch are wonderful! We also love the Dahlia lounge for dinner- it's right across the street. Decor- modern, hip, fun

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: surfgirl1954
Reviews.Content: Hotel Andra is a great little hotel in the heart of downtown Seattle. Pike's Market, shopping, and dining are easily within walking distance and the bus and light rail easily accessible within a couple of blocks. Great location. The rooms are large and spotlessly clean. The bathroom is small but there is a nice walk in shower and make up mirror with good lighting. The suites have a cushy sofa that pulls out to a comfortable bed. The lobby is warm and welcoming. I appreciated the fireplace coming in from the cold weather. Our check in was delayed due to linen arriving late which was disappointing after a long flight. We were finally given keys to a room that other guests were clearly occupying. The staff was quick to get us to another room and get us settled in. The front desk staff was very friendly, helpful, and efficient, however, two of the doorman were often too busy talking to actually open the door. Internet connection is not free. Overall, good experience and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Boutique Hotel in the Heart of Seattle”
Reviews.Author: DulceVida-TX
Reviews.Content: Hotel Andra is a beautiful boutique hotel in the heart of Seattle, short walking district to the Pikes market, shopping, and restaurants. The lobby is warm with a enticing NorthWest feel, and the lobby bar and restaurant has outstanding wine and dinner selections. The staff is extremely attentive and helpful, and make you feel welcome from the moment you arrive. The rooms are very comfortable and roomy. They have been updated, with comfortable beds, lost of task and mood lighting, an ample work area on the desk, a wet bar and mini-bar, and a sizable closet. The bathroom, while small, is thoughtfully designed, with a walk-in shower, a large vanity, with a back heated mirror (so it doesn't fog) with lighting built in...it's amazing. Downsides: Bathroom slightly smaller than ideal Downtown noise can be heard in some lower floors No frequent flier or hotel points Upsides Really plush and cool Outstanding service Fabulous location

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous room and great central location!!!”
Reviews.Author: cynthia_alfonso619
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just visited Seattle for the first time and stayed at Hotel Andra. We loved that it was central to everything and walking distance to all the restaurants, Pike's Pier and all the shopping. The hotel has a gorgeous and sexy lounge/lobby when we arrived which helped jump start the vacation feeling. I can't wait to come back and visit and I will definitely come and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Katy M
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed overnight at Hotel Andra for a "stay-cation" and would highly recommend the hotel for both personal and business trips. The hotel is in a great location...walking distance to all the downtown shopping, Pike Place Market and many restaurants. The staff is very professional and courteous. The rooms were very neat clean and the beds were extremely comfortable. Would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: West_coast_17
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Andra for a weekend visit to Seattle. It was my second stay at the Andra in the past three years, and I would definitely return. Convenient location close to restaurants, shops, and the waterfront. Stylish and comfortable rooms. Did not hear any noise from neighbours or from the street outside.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, bright, cheerful, chic”
Reviews.Author: Chonav
Reviews.Content: I stayed doe 4 days at Hotel Andra in Seattle. It is a clean, unpretentious hotel where the food is great and the staff wonderful! The hotel is clean, bright , cheerful and chic, Food at the restaurant -Lola- is magnificent. Points of interest are within walking distance. I certainly will stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: MDSeitz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Andra on a recent business trip per the recommendation of a colleague. Having only been to the Seattle area once before, this was a new experience for me and as a female traveling alone, I wanted to be sure the hotel was easy to get to and safe. Hotel Andra delivered on all fronts. The staff was extremely friendly and the room was more than accomodating. Plus, the location made it very easy to walk to nearby restaurants, shops and attractions (Pike's Place Market and the original Starbucks are a few blocks away). Next time I travel to Seattle, I am definitely planning to stay at Hotel Andra.

Reviews.Title: “Most helpful hotel staff ever”
Reviews.Author: Daniel B
Reviews.Content: Every time I needed something from the staff, they were able to help me - customer service 5*

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff, Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ckotro
Reviews.Content: I needed to go to Seattle on business so we decided to make it a mini-vacation in the process! We had a great experience at the hotel and in Seattle! We stayed 3 nights in a Luxe Suite and feel like, compared to "normal" prices for a downtown hotel room, we got a good deal at $169 per night. Andra is close to EVERYTHING downtown. It's an easy 4 block walk to Pike Place Market, 2 blocks to Westlake Center for shopping, and there are outstanding restaurants all over the place. You can also take the monorail from Westlake for a 5 minute trip to the Space Needle and the EMP. The Sea-Tac train is across the street from Westlake as well so you can take it from the airport and back if you don't mind taking your luggage two blocks. We had carry-ons so it wasn't a big deal. You don't need a car here! Everything is close! :) We were met by the front desk employees for check-in and it went very smoothly. The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable about the area and the city. They also did things little things for you like hit the "down" button on the elevator for you as you walked down the hall if they happened to be standing close by. The lobby is great for sitting and visiting with friends or colleagues with nice furniture and a fireplace. There is easy access off the lobby to the bar area as well. The place is decorated beautifully with contemporary furnishings. The room was a typical two-room suite with a living area and separate bedroom with a french door entry. There was a couple of flat screen TVs and a desk for work if you need it. My wife liked the sitting area for putting on make-up, and that was needed considering the bathroom was a little on the small side. This is normal for older hotels that have been remodeled and it wasn't an issue. The entire room was roomy, and comfortable. There was ZERO wear and tear on this place. The upkeep seems to be really good and they take great care in making the place very clean. It's even nicer than it looks in the photos. My wife commented that it "looks better than the web site". The turn down service was great too as they put on nice music and leave delicious dark chocolates. Restaurants: Eat at Lola in the lobby! Great eggs benedict! Across the street is Dahlia Lounge which was good. Serious Pie (pizza) is across the street on Virginia Street and is SERIOUSLY good. We had it twice! Ralph's Grocery is at the end of the block on 4th Street take a right out of the lobby and it's on the corner. They have a really good wine selection, groceries, food, etc. I was actually really surprised how nice it was inside. Of course, go the the market on the water, and don't miss Etta's for AMAZING crab benedict and Cafe Campagne for some of the best French food I've ever had! Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in the city”
Reviews.Author: Daniel M
Reviews.Content: Hotel Andra was fantastic and one of the best hotels I have stayed at for a very long time. The staff was great, having Lola in the lobby was terrific and I enjoyed all the small details, like quiet ice machines in the hallways! I will make Hotel Andra my home away from home when in Seattle from now on.

Reviews.Title: “A Travel Writer's Opinion - A Modern Residential Feel”
Reviews.Author: TravelbyLori
Reviews.Content: LOCATION The hotel is in the center of Seattle. Fantastic restaurants, a remarkable array of shops and Seattle Art Museum (adorably called SAM) are within walking distance. When I realized the famous Pike Place Market is only four blocks away, I made it top priority after check-in to see the throwing of the fish. If you don’t know what I mean, you need to come see for yourself. ROOMS I tend to believe it is an advantage for a hotel to begin as apartments. My husband and I travel non-stop to review hotels and agree that larger rooms with a homey feel tend to be much more livable than a standard hotel room. Hotel Ändra’s 119 rooms also incorporate a nice desk, good lighting, plenty of outlets, and a clock with iPod input making it conducive to working as well. BEYOND ROOMS The design here is anything but beige! Ändra went to great lengths to be genuine in its tribute to the design of Scandinavia. The lobby or Living Room (as it is called) has a huge fireplace flanked by chopped wood, ready to warm those by the fire. The bookcases above the wood supply display beautiful glass vases and books on Scandinavia. My favorite feature in the entire hotel was the real aquarium, simply adorned with lights and brilliant green grass. DINING In my opinion, Seattle is a Dining Destination. Hotel on-site restaurants have to compete with the best of the best in the culinary world, especially when they serve seafood. “Lola” serves Pacific Northwest fare with a Greek influence. The restaurant holds its own, especially with desserts. The mini doughnuts with dipping sauce are delicious. HISTORY Hotel Ändra has taken Seattle’s metropolitan vibe and the tasteful simplicity of Scandinavian design to create a vibrant boutique hotel in the heart of the city’s most exciting area. The building began as apartments in 1926 then became a transfer station for the Women’s Army Corps in 1945. In the 70s, it found its calling as a small hotel and in 2004 completed its metamorphosis into the modern hotel it is now—all without losing its original charm. It’s no wonder that its name means “change” in Swedish. MY RECOMMENDATION When I choose a hotel to review, it has already passed a thorough vetting. On occasion, a hotel exceeds my expectations as this one did. I enjoyed my time very much at Hotel Ändra. I recommend it based on its excellent location, friendly staff, home-like feel, gorgeous décor, and wonderful desserts.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kenny S
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice, once overlooking the street, the last time looking onto the roof of an old building. I must say if I was reviewing the staff alone, it would say excellent. The rooms just seem really old with lots of new paint and decor. The rooms I stayed in were small and not all that comfortable. Maybe I'm just not the boutique hotel kind of guy. For the price, I think there are nicer places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Andra, Seattle, Washington”
Reviews.Author: L0h
Reviews.Content: My mother, sister and I were in Seattle celebrating my sister's 60th birthday. The Hotel Andra was the perfect in every way. Friendly,beautiful, clean, great location - we had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for business”
Reviews.Author: saritter
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel, great consistency, fabulous staff and very centrally located for work downtown, nightife and shopping. Very clean design, and warm and inviting. HIGHLY recommend breakfast at Lola, and dinner next door at Assaggion, tell Mauro hello!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for shopping!”
Reviews.Author: TJ73
Reviews.Content: I arrived with some trepidation as I had read some of the poor & terrible reviews in order to be prepared for what could go wrong. As well, this was my first stay at a hotel found on Trip Advisor so wasn't totally sure how accurate the reviews really were. I was completely satisfied with my choice and had a great stay. The valet/bellboys were most welcoming and efficient. I actually watched the valet running all the way to get our car from the parkade for us when we were leaving. The location was excellent for shopping. Nordstroms is about a 5 min walk at a slow pace. We took advantage of their Suite Deal and had a lovely corner suite. There was plenty of space and the room was very nicely appointed. I loved the big, full length mirror. The bathroom was a bit small compared to other luxury hotels, however, they have made great use of the available space - plenty of counters and a lovely full shower with great amenities. In fact, I took several pictures and measurements to get ideas for my own small bathroom reno. The bed was very comfortable and the room lighting was good. There was some street noise during the night, (particularly a beeping cross walk), but this did not surprise me as any downtown hotel is bound to have city noise - all part of the adventure! However, if noise really bothers you, you might want to stay out of the downtown core, or ask for the quieter side. The hotel restaurant is excellent - the dinner menu has lots of choices with a greek influence. For breakfast, the doughnuts with marscapone & jam is incredible. I would definitly stay here for another mother/daughter shopping trip.

Reviews.Title: “Seattle Stay”
Reviews.Author: John D
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay and the Hotel proximity to the Space Neddle, Art Museum, Pike's Market, Aquarium and fine dinning was all within walking distance. We had a great lunch at Cafe Presse on Capital Hill and Enjoyied Wine & Dinning at Le Pichet at 1st & Virginia 3 blocks from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: TexMexZilian
Reviews.Content: The rooms are spacious and very comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful. Boutique hotels are not normally the best option if you are traveling with kids but we took our 2yo and were pleasantly surprised. The size of the rooms and in-room counter and made our stay that much pleasant. You can't beat the hotel's downtown location. It's within walking distance of the Space Needle and Pike Place. You can basically walk everywhere if you want to. It is also across the street from great restaurants. We definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: psoxman
Reviews.Content: Every time I come to Seattle I stay at the Andra. It is very conveniently located, downtown, and is across the street from a wonderful deli that stays open late and carries everything that a traveller might need. The staff is very professional and helpful, and the beds and pillows are really comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms, helpful staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: MrsAWW
Reviews.Content: I will absolutely stay here again next time I'm in Seattle. The rooms are well-laid out and of a good size, clean, and comfortable in every way. The hotel staff is incredibly helpful with every request, and overall, my experience was ideal. As other travelers have noted, the location is fantastic, with tons of great restaurant choices within walking distance. One other benefit I really enjoyed during my stay was the hotel's partnership with Urban Yoga Spa, the hot yoga studio one block away. As a hotel guest, you can get one free class AND free towel rental for the length of your stay. It's a great studio, and a great deal!

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend in Seattle!”
Reviews.Author: van2go
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many hotels in downtown Seattle. We go several times a year to catch some entertainment or just to get away. The Hotel Andra is the BEST place we have stayed. Fantastic location, great specials on rates, terrific friendly staff and very clean contemporary rooms. Loved the bar and all the adjacent restaurants. Can hardly wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great staff”
Reviews.Author: andrewthak
Reviews.Content: Great location in Seattle, very well appointed hotel and the staff is really helpful and pleasant. Room was twice as big as I expected, had a cool, funky feel to it without being over the top. Fitness center is very small but nice enough to get a workout in while there, about what you'd expect from a small boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you want”
Reviews.Author: CorryVW
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, quiet room, stylish appointments, cozy lounge, helpful staff, all conveniently located to downtown Seattle and even better to Belltown with all those fabulous, funky restaurants and cocktail lounges within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Mallory L
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Andra for two nights in May 2011 before departing for a cruise to Alaska. Having never been to Seattle before, we were pleased to find that the location of the hotel was WONDERFUL! It was in a great part of town within walking distance of most of downtown. The King County light rail is only two and half blocks away, and many other metro bus stops are also close. The Westlake Shopping Center is only two blocks away, and a variety dining options are nearby. The restaurant at the hotel, Lola, was amazing. We ate dinner there the first day, and the food was the best we had in Seattle. The staff was also very helpful and had a cab waiting to pick us up Sunday morning to take us to the pier. We also got a great deal on our stay because we were able to get a discount for booking early. I will definitely stay at Hotel Andra again the next time we travel to Seattle. I highly recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Bala B
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for just a few nights and loved the atmosphere. It has a great bar with tasty snacks and drinks. Reccomend to stay there when in Seattle, great location and close to everything!

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: shannon x
Reviews.Content: good location. good service.walk to pike place market and art museum. walk distance to shop

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: ITA_And_RE_a
Reviews.Content: Andra has a prime location near downtown and Belltown for restaurants and bars. The hotel rooms are quite spacious and the staff is very both friendly and helpful. With great restaurants in the hotel and across the street its perfect if your trip will be rainy!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: mjseagle1
Reviews.Content: We were in Seattle celebrating a friend's birthday and selected Hotel Andra due to the positive reviews and proximity to dinner (RN74 which was excellent). We purchased the 'Urban Package' which includes Valet Parking (reg $38/night) and a $40 voucher to about 4 different Tom Douglas restaurants, all of which are within 1 block of the hotel. We chose to use the certificate at Lola (fresh hot hand melt in your mouth donuts, best Bloody Mary's which included jalepeno infused Vodka and Eggs Benedict from scratch, one of the best breakfasts we have ever had). The room was quite large, very clean, contemporary, oversized robes, Starbucks coffee maker, flat screen, wine glasses and opener, ironing board, seperate powder area,we were on the 7th floor and had city views which were fun at night. The 4 Star review is due to one area that while not the hotel's fault could be rectified with a simple solution and that is the street noise heard all night long. I suggest small ear plugs like the Chrysalis in Bellingham supplies guests for the train noise (not the same train VS cars however light sleepers will be disapointed to be awake all night). We want to acknowledge Justin for his amazing guest service (remembering our names, hailing cabs within seconds, remembering where we were going and where we had been) as a manager myself it is team members such as he that bring customers back, service, service, service. Even with the car noise we would return, it was just that wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Night in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: npkras
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd time staying at Hotel Andra in downtown Seattle. Very conveniently located, Hotel Andra provides a comfortable stay in a lovely room. Staff is friendly and acommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room”
Reviews.Author: IncurableTraveler
Reviews.Content: Had a great one night stay at the Andra as we were stuck in Seattle during the recent snowstorm. I called from the airport and got a great rate over the phone. We'd eaten at the restaurant off the lobby before and thought it looked like a cool hotel. We had a room on the 7th floor which matched the vibe of the lobby - Scandinavian chic without becoming too ikea. Nice view over 4th Ave. Bathroom had a large shower instead of a tub. Plus: Bed was very comfy, Frette towels, no hallway noise Minus: heating fan kept cycling on and off all night. We could sleep, but it was a bit loud. No free wifi, but if you check in on 4Square and show the front desk they will give you a code. Otherwise a great stay in my favorite part of town: close to downtown shopping, the market, light rail to the airport, and Belltown.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Nomad1999
Reviews.Content: The hotel Andra is a cosy modern boutique hotel in a perfect location for exploring downtown Seattle.All of the staff are wonderful lola is a must for breakfast ans serious pie across the street is a must for dinner. I will be staying at this hotel on my next trip to Seattle

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel right in the middle of downtown Seattle!”
Reviews.Author: ffarfan
Reviews.Content: A very chic yet cozy hotel! The front desk crew is amazingly helpful! Don't forget to have breakfast at Lola, the hotel's greek restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “Best Boutique Hotel in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: suncentral
Reviews.Content: Ideal spot to stay for businees or that specail night out...Close to the Monorail to get to the Seattle Center...easy walk to Pikes Place Market, Westlake Mall (orignal Nordstroms first building)...Seattle water front and ferries...Aslo many great restaurants and bars (including Lola's in the Hotel)

Reviews.Title: “Extra Special Service”
Reviews.Author: glenbates
Reviews.Content: My wife and I planned to spend four nights at Hotel Andra, but on the fourth day I ended up spending the night at Harborview Medical Center. The staff at Hotel Andra went out of their way to extend our stay in the same room which had been previously booked. Hotel Andra is very well run with a very friendly and efficient staff. We will definitively return. Lola Restaurant in the Hotel is also superb. The restaurant served my wife late at night when she returned from Harborview.

Reviews.Title: “Relax in style!”
Reviews.Author: Alisa L
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at Hotel Andra! Staff was very friendly and polite, accommodations were comfortable and stylish. We especially enjoyed the warm and inviting lobby - whether it was sitting by the fire or in the comfortable "Jetsons" chairs! Loved how the hotel is within walking distance to almost everything! (including the fabulous Dahlia Lounge) Will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “New Years Eve in Seattle...Perfect!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Foodiesontheloose
Reviews.Content: Our previous stay at the Hotel Andra made it an easy decision for our destination with friends to celebrate New Year's Eve week. A cozy fire was burning in the lobby upon our arrival and the staff attentive in every way always with a smile and friendly comment. The location can't be beat - the rooms very comfortable including the heavenly bed - and, the Tom Douglas restaurants surrounding the location including Lola's in the hotel were incredible!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Amy L
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at Hotel Andra for our 12th anniversary. When I called to inquire of making a reservation, they were very helpful and informed me of a great special that saved me money. The valet parking attendants were pleasant and willing to help in anyway. The check-in and check-out process was very inviting and friendly. The room was fantastic, and we enjoyed our city view. The location was favorable with Nordstrom's and Pikes Place Market nearby. What we really enjoyed was the adjoined restaurant, Lola's! My husband and I can't recommend enough the freshly made doughnuts. YUMMY! The service there was also top notch. We can't wait for another opportunity to return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic weekend - Amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Vicki H
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a New Year's Eve wedding to attend, as well as our anniversary to celebrate. We spent 2 nights at Hotel Andra, and made a fun weekend of it. The hotel is beautiful in every way, the most comfortable beds, and the staff could not have been friendlier or more helpful. The location was perfect - we walked everywhere, and only took our car out to go to the wedding. Lots of great shopping and restaurants very nearby. We will definitely think of Hotel Andra the next time we want to stay in the city. Awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: FrasL
Reviews.Content: The service was execellent. The staff were very helpful. It was a fun lobby with a lovely fireplace. The front desk staff were super friendly and knowledgeable. I will stay here again. And you can not be in a better location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for tourism.”
Reviews.Author: mickbcm
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Andra for 2 nights. The sleek modern room was perfect. The best part of the hotel is its location. It was an easy walk to Nordstrom’s, Pikes Place Market, and Monorail etc. This is the place to stay if you are traveling to Seattle for tourism.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Treasure”
Reviews.Author: BRW73
Reviews.Content: Hotel Andra is a hidden treasure in Seattle. Located in an older but classy building, once you walk in the door, it's modern yet warm charm envelopes you. The staff is friendly and very helpful yet not obtrusive. Our room this trip, a suite, was large, very nicely furnished and comfortable. For the value, this place is a hidden treasure. Excellent restaurants nearby, valet parking and close to Pike Place and downtown, Hotel Andra hits a home run.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn C
Reviews.Content: The staff was very gracious and helpful, from getting my suit pressed and returned to me within a couple of hours (a complimentary service), to reserving cabs for me, to making recommendations around the neighborhood. The service at the adjoining restaurant, Lola, was also fantastic. The room was spacious and comfortable. The hotel is located very close to a lot of great shopping, restaurants, and tourist attractions. My only complaint was that my room faced the street, and the street lights in downtown Seattle beep when they turn green to tell pedestrians that it is safe to walk--at night, this beeping, while faint, was still audible, and that was kind of annoying since I'm a very light sleeper. Maybe ask for a room that doesn't face the street when you make a reservation, or one that is on a higher floor (I was on the 3rd floor).

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Andra: Where it's at”
Reviews.Author: TheatreAfficionada
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed here on 2 occasions and have been impressed each time with the courtesy and laid back quality of the employees. Of course one can't beat the location, either. I flew in from China and it was an easy 2 blocks from the light rail station to the hotel. It's easy to take public transport to anywhere in the Puget Sound area. The hotel specials are the best around and beat out anything else in this category.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place- be it a long or a short stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: CM_G279
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we have stayed at the Hotel Andra.. and we just really love it! Close to the shopping areas, several great restaurants, Pike Place Market, Paramount and Moore Theaters, the monorail to Seattle Center-- basically all of the areas that travelers would want to see on a trip to Seattle. The staff is courteous, the rooms well appointed = the bed was SOOOO comfortable... definitely would recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Clean, Friendly in Central Seattle”
Reviews.Author: WellTraveledJJ
Reviews.Content: This a great hotel, right in the central part of Seattle & just a few blocks from Pike Market. Highly recommended. JJ

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to rest for two nights”
Reviews.Author: outadelaware
Reviews.Content: Long flight, wonderful doorman, sent us to Palace kitchen around the corner for exactly what we needed. The room was comfy and location was centrally located for the touristy things we wanted to do. The gym could use another machine, had to wait both days. Thats the only negative comment I can make about the hotel. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Our sixth year”
Reviews.Author: pwjprun
Reviews.Content: This was our sixth year to stay at the Andra at Thanksgiving. The staff as usual were wonderful, welcoming and helpful. I was disappointed the bathtubs have been removed in some rooms in the renovation, but the manager has noted we prefer one with a tub for next year, and I'm glad that is an option. The new showers are nice looking, but impossible to turn on and adjust without getting wet. We were on a high floor and facing away from the street, which eliminates the street noise. Next time I will ask to be away from the housekeeping closet--noisy during "nap time." I love the location to so many Tom Douglas restaurants, although Lola (in the Hotel) is not my favorite for either service or food, but Serious Pie, Dahlia Cafe and Dahlia Bakery are across the street. It's also a great location if you're running the Seattle Marathon, less than two blocks from the official race hotel and about one mile from the start of the race.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, room & service”
Reviews.Author: Gary J
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at the hotel. We had passed it at a prior stay and had noted it's great location- close to Pikes Place, Seattle center, restaurants & shopping. We had one of the suites, which was quite large and well laid out. Several closets and storage in the bathroom. 3 great restaurants on the same block, and a grocery store on the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: whobaa
Reviews.Content: My brother and sister flew into Seattle to celebrate the holidays, and we wanted a downtown venue. None of us had ever stayed at the Andra, but we all loved it. Incredible rooms, great service, and perfect location for getting out and walking around Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite Seattle hotel”
Reviews.Author: TrishaMD
Reviews.Content: I travel to Seattle on business every two-three months and Hotel Andra is my favorite palce to stay. It's in Belltown within easy wakling distance to Pike's Place Martket, Seattle Art Museum, shopping and great restaurants. I typically stay in a superia room which has a sitting area, desk and kitchen counter. The bathrooms are small but functional with good showers. There is also a separate dressing/make-up area. I've also stayed in a suite a couple times; it is a bit bigger and as comfortable. The staff is friendly and helpful. Wifi is included if you are a Stash rewords member. Drawbacks include pricey valet/overnight parking (but that may be typical for the neighborhood) and you can hear traffic noise even on the higher floors. All-in-all, a comfortable hotel with fabulous food a stone's throw away.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel for the price...”
Reviews.Author: Ces_Mark
Reviews.Content: Hotel Andra is right on the corner of 4th Avenue and Virginia. It's close to downtown and Pike Place. The room was really large with a walk in closet. Shower only but the bathroom was nicely laid out. The drawback is the noise from the street. We stayed on the fifth floor but the windows are poorly insulated, so we heard all the car, bus, and pedestrian traffic. It was really noisy. The front staff as well as the valet's were friendly. Free computer/internet service around the corner from the front desk was easy to use when looking up addresses. Wouldn't stay there again. The hotel restaurant was okay but the service there was terrible. The waitress and hotess were less than welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: travelingkerry
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently on our first trip to Seattle. We LOVED it! We had a junior suite and the room was spacious and clean with a great view. The staff were friendly and accommodating. The attached restaurant is fantastic and it's close to two other Tom Douglas restaurants across the street. We'll definitely stay here again if we return to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “brusque manager”
Reviews.Author: artnouveauian
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located conveniently in downtown Seattle with several good restaurants steps away, but the brusque manager was not welcoming at check-in, and when our car was returned from valet parking ($39 !) at departure time with a flat tire, the directive from the manager after the hotel pump was not found was to "go down the street to get it fixed," with no apology or acceptance of responsibility. He needs to learn a bit of Pacific Northwest cordiality.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service!”
Reviews.Author: Mary3456
Reviews.Content: Every year I meet a friend for a "Seattle Night", we've stayed numerous places throughout the years always looking for a holiday package that is both a good value and offers a luxurious stay. The beds were very comfortable, the linens deluxe, and the service outstanding. Valet service was prompt and parking costs were included. The connected restaurant (Lola) has superb food. The location is perfect for pretty much any Seattle activity. We'd stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent boutique hotel in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: MrHudsonBay
Reviews.Content: An outstanding smaller hotel. Perfect location to walk down to the Pike Place Market, across the street to the many restaurants or just a few blocks to so much more that Seattle has to offer. Walk 3 blocks to the mall and take the monorail to the Seattle Center (the Space Needle and the EMP) or the light rail to the airport for $2.50. I was in town strictly for fun with my wife and the Hotel Andra offered everything for a romantic and enjoyable stay. The rooms seemed large, well appointed and comfortable. Only downside was hearing so much of the street noise (including the walk/don't walk audio prompts). I prefer boutique hotels and this was an great place.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding boutique hôtel in downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Travelerontherun
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at this hotel. The room was quite spacious and comfortable and the couch was even comfortable to sit in. The staff were extremely friendly, helpful and knowledgable of the local area and were able to recommend several neat restaurants close to the hotel. I was in town for the Seattle Marathon, and this hotel was close to the where the bib/chip pick up and where the post race buses took runners after the race was over. This place is a gem and was very reasonably priced in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms, Great Location, Limited On-Site Fitness Options”
Reviews.Author: Matthew B
Reviews.Content: The location was extremely convenient to downtown Seattle with the Washington State Convention Center and Pike Place market both a brief stroll from Hotel Andra. Dining choices seemed abundant and I would note in particular that the Dahlia Lounge is located just across the street (the freshly made donuts for desert are superb). My room was spacious and well furnished and I'd note the internet supported my VPN (which is not always the case). My single complaint with the accomodations was the fitness center, which is tiny (one bike, one treadmill, one eliptical machine, and a few dumbbells). While the hotel also apparently offers access to both a local yoga studio and a gym (at a separate fee) as well as running options, I did not have the time this trip to explore the former two and rainy November weather precluded running (for me at least).

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Comfort, Ambiance, and Service”
Reviews.Author: Chris C
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend Hotel Andra for the shear comfort, location, ambiance, and service. We enjoyed a relaxing and romantic weekend and Hotel Andra was the perfect location to enjoy Seattle from.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: chris c
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a week for a conference. My first impression of the hotel was that it was modern, clean and newly refurnished and the bedroom was the same way. Close to everything, restaurants, light rail, convention center ... etc. Even after staying a week I had no major gripes. The only minor gripe I had was that the walls were a bit thin as I heard my neighbors a couple times. Also street noise was heard a bit. But I had ear plugs so no biggee! Also, I never complained about it, but the pillows weren't as plush as I'd hope for.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Look Further!”
Reviews.Author: d f
Reviews.Content: Our experience from beginning to end could not have been better. Jennifer helped with reservations assigning us the perfect room and was fantastic at sharing how to arrive, the easiest way, from SeaTac. All of the hotel staff were helpful and friendly. The hotel common areas were comfortable, well lit with fabulous ombience. We were close to the Link light rail and the Monorail. We had a short walk to Pikes Market and fabuolous dining all right there or within a couple of blocks. Should you forget to pack something, you can buy it within walking distance from the hotel. From toiletries, gloves, hat, jacket, wine, toys, shoes, everything is convenient. The streets are well-lit and shopping abundant. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Service Extraordinaire”
Reviews.Author: C B
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Monarch Suite, which they had donated as a charity auction purchase. Taking advantage of the size of the accommodations, we held a birthday party catered by Tom Douglas Catering. The hotel service was exceptional as was the catering. I found the staff more than willing to do what they could to make our stay an extremely enjoyable and memorable one. They succeed on both counts. It is well located, close to the center of town and some of the best shopping establishments in Seattle. Although this was a one time special event, if I were to stay again I would definitely stay in one of the Lux Suites, which are affordable yet give good value.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find In Seattle”
Reviews.Author: kba1964
Reviews.Content: When planning my recent business trip to Seattle there were very few hotel rooms left in the city. I had never stayed at Hotel Andra before, but TA reviews were positive, so I booked it. It's been a great experience. It is about 3 blocks from the light rail, so I could avoid taking a cab or renting a car from the airport to downtown. It's about 5 blocks to the Pike Place Market and waterfront. The room is very clean, and the staff very helpful. I was a little worried about the location of my room when I first arrived. It's immediately across the hall from the elevator, but it has turned out to be a non-issue. It's been really quiet. I will definitely try to stay here again when back in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Stay”
Reviews.Author: Samantha T
Reviews.Content: We, our wedding party and family stayed at Hotel Andra the weekend of our wedding. It was FABULOUS! Hotel Andra's staff worked very hard to make sure everything was perfect. Our friends and family kept commenting on the level of detail in the hotel as well as how accommodating the hotel staff were. The rooms, lobby, bar and Lola restaurant were all beautiful and the perfect place to celebrate for a wedding. We were especially impressed when we returned back after our reception and there was champagne and pretty music playing on the radio for us! I could not have found a more perfect place on the most important day of my life. They truly helped to make it perfect. I highly reccommend!

Reviews.Title: “Overall OK experience, friendly staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: CanadianinMadrid
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night and thought the hotel was ok. The rooms are pretty basic but clean. I think the hotel was recently renovated as some of it seems quite new but forced into an old room layout. Comfortable bed and a good sleep. The bathroom is very small and the toilet is the kind that you get in a gas station, not impressed with that. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Room service food was excellent. The business center was small but functional, however expensive at $28 to access for 15 minutes and print out a dozen pages.

Reviews.Title: “My home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: Jeff G
Reviews.Content: I commute from the SF Bay Area to Seattle for business at least half the year, and every week, I choose to stay at the Hotel Andra. Why? Because it's damn near perfect. The service/reception is about the friendliest/most helpful I've ever experienced, and never fails to help me out should I ever need anything. The rooms are modern and clean without being sterile. Room service includes both food from the phenomenal Lola Restaurant (part of the hotel), as well as Serious Pie, the excellent pizza joint across the street. You're walking distance to both downtown as well as to the Space Needle and other prime Seattle attractions. I'm going up to Seattle again tonight, and for the first time in months won't be staying there because I failed to book far enough in advance, and I can't tell you how bummed I am. I know that any other place I stay will pale in comparison. Can't recommend the Andra enough.

Reviews.Title: “have had better experiences.”
Reviews.Author: abc123001
Reviews.Content: on arrival bag to front desk where is the lift.find own way to room. check mini bar items missing advise staff made mistake in not getting signed copy of report. get home find been charged for missing item.had two starbucks coffe satchels of my own they grew legs.I must say they are going to credit my credit card.The kitchen was closed along with the bar for updateing want a drink go across the road. On a comparison between the ANDRA and the GEORGIAN COURT in VANCOUVER give me the GEORGIAN any time. Will be in SEATTLE next year will be staying some where else

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Front Desk Staff”
Reviews.Author: vicbroke99
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Andra is a terrific hotel in an excellent location, within walking distance to all downtown highlights as well as Seattle Centre. The Front Desk staff are beyond compare. Every time you depart or return to the hotel, there is a personal greeting/welcome. We did have a slight problem with our reservation, but this was resolved beyond our expectations immediately and graciously. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel for any type of visit to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Andra: a fantastic stay in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Chris D
Reviews.Content: I've had the fortune of staying at Hotel Andra for both business and pleasure. I travel just about full time around the country and Hotel Andra is by far the best hotel out there, and for a good reasonable price! Location to transit, downtown, restaurants, shopping is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Seattle”
Reviews.Author: dlwcoast
Reviews.Content: Boutique hotels are the way to go in Seattle, and The Andra is great. I loved the location - easy walking to downtown attractions and shopping, and also an easy walk to the rail station for getting back to the airport. We checked in late and tired, and got surprised with an upgrade to a huge suite. Heavenly!

Reviews.Title: “My 'home' in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: britchick73
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently to Seattle for business and the Andra is where I consider home when I'm in town. The staff are great and the welcome is always room. Beds are super-comfy and rooms a good size, with good storage space. The food is excellent, and the location right on the doorstep of downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff and great rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Arron Z
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Andra for a week in August, arriving on the weekend of the Seafair so the hotel was very busy. I arrived very tired after a 20hr journey from Egypt and was very quickly checked in and shown to my room. I was pleasantly surprised by the spacious room and its cool, retro furnishings. The bed was extremely comfortable and a weeks worth of good sleep was had. The bar at Lola is a great place to hang out and have a few drinks and meet locals, I did not eat there so can not comment on the food. The staff were extremely friendly and professional, and the only slight gripe I have is on one of the days housekeeping instead of changing one of the dirty towels left on the floor just folded it and hang it up again but this was resolved within 5 minutes of me calling housekeeping. I would definitely stay in this hotel again, and will recommend to anyone who visits Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Great!”
Reviews.Author: Vladimir G
Reviews.Content: My wife and I love Hotel Andra, which has a great location accessing to everything you need. It is an old building with interestingly, cozily contemporary layout. Our room was great. Realizing we are Russians when we were approaching the desk, the front desk agent (the very cute, smiley asian guy) spoke some Russian to us, welcoming us warmly and hospitably. We were surprised and felt so welcomed. It was amazing! We loved him. He showed us what to do, what to see in Seattle, asked if he was of any further help before giving us the room keys very attentively. Everytime he saw us, he smiled and greeted us in Russian, calling our name. He was also the one who checked us out, again with a very warm and sincere smile. To our question, he said he speaks also German and some French...Incredible....What an asset he is! We had a great time in Seattle. And this guy made our stay more memorable! Thanks to him!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: pme701
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, within walking distance to several area attractions. I was glad that I had upgraded the room to get a little extra space. As other reviewers have noted, the bathrooms are quite minimalist and not what one would normally expect. The lack of vanity area and very poor lighting can be an issue. The staff was lovely, very courteous and helpful especially the doormen. One of the very best things about Hotel Andra is Lola restaurant, but that will be a separate review :-)

Reviews.Title: “Some Good, Some Not So Good”
Reviews.Author: koebe
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from the Hotel Andra. We booked the Northern Neighbours Package that included free internet and 50% off parking and a complimentary room grade upon arrival. Before leaving home I decided I wanted to guarantee the suite, so I emailed the hotel and asked to be moved into a Suite, the told me there were not any available. So I checked Hotels.ca and there were suites showing as available. I phoned the Hotel and was told that there were suites, so upgrade my reservation. Then later that same day I received and email saying there had been cancellations so a suite was available (this email from the person that had earlier said there were no suites until I asked via email why Hotels.ca was showing them). So all that was a bit confusing for me. In the end we got the suite as a complimentary upgrade for the misunderstanding and miscommunication. First, I love small boutique hotels, I am not a fan of mega hotels. I loved the lobby and the design. I loved the furnishings in the rooms, a mix of contemporary decor within a historic building. One issue though was the lighting in the room was horrible. I could not see in the closet, I could not see in the dresser and had to feel around for my clothes, even with the lights all turned on and the drapes open. The bathroom was surprisingly small considering the size of the rest of the suite. We had also asked for housekeeping to put the pull our sofa away during the day and make it up again at night for our daughter. This never happened as requested. We also arrived back one afternoon at 4:00 to find the room still had not been cleaned for the day. This was quite disappointing. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful and treated my daughter with respect and kindness. The location was great for walking pretty much everywhere. The TV in the elevator - they have to go.... I don't watch TV and I don't allow my daughter to watch TV so I am very disturbed when I see TVs in public spaces where I have no control over what she sees. And even if I was not traveling with her , I don't want to be bombarded by marketing and the negativity on the news in every public space I visit. The desk space in the suite was great for working however the internet was quite sloe..So all in all some mixed feelings about the hotel. Certainly much of my concerns could be dealt with the exception of a larger bathroom

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: Debra4569
Reviews.Content: We're from B.C. and go to Seattle at least once a year for a few nights and have stayed at various places and out daughter was there with friends, looked at Hotel Andra and suggested we might want to check it out. We did just that and we love this hotel! It is quaint and comfortable, with a touch of cool. We like to park and walk and this is perfectly located for that. The staff was very friendly, attentive and professional. We love that there are little corners on the second floor where you can sit and have a drink, read a book, or whatever. Lola's for breakfast was phenomenal, their bacon is awesome and granola with yogurt unreal. We plan to return next year to Hotel Andra with a group of friends that we B & B with as an urban getaway, and really look forward to that experience!

Reviews.Title: “a bit disappointed”
Reviews.Author: kgwilburn
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Hotel Andra several times and were a bit disappointed this year. I called to make reservations over a month in advance, and, to make sure we got a Lux Suite with a bath tub. I was assured one was available for a two night stay of October 13-15, our last stop before heading home from a 10 day vacation on Vancouver Island. They wouldn't give me their usual "hot rate" we had be given in the past, but did honor my AARP card. When we arrived early afternoon on the 13th they gave us a room on the 4th floor, front corner. I asked if it had a bath tub and the young lady at the front desk said yes. When we went to the room it was a Lux Suite, but with only a shower. I called down to inquire and never got a return call so I went to the front desk myself. I was informed that there was only one Lux Suite with a tub and it was in use. They were willing to downgrade me to a smaller room with a tub, but that was it. The other lady, maybe front desk manager, was just matter of fact about it all, and not a bit concerned. Also, it took forever for our car to be brought out front the first couple of times we asked. We always called ahead, giving them plenty of time to walk across the street to the parking garage and go up the 4 levels to get the car. Lola's was closed for kitchen renovation, opening back up the last night we were there. Not a big deal as we always eat elsewhere in Seattle. We have always enjoyed staying at Hotel Andra, great location and usually very accomodating. The Lux Suites are wonderful! I hope their service is not slipping.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great service, great food!”
Reviews.Author: Anne S
Reviews.Content: My organization had a meeting at Hotel Andra in the spring. We had an event at another hotel recently, and it didn’t remotely compare to our experience with Hotel Andra. The staff was so much more professional in every way, prompt with information, helpful with questions and planning, and not to mention the difference in food, the food was absolutely amazing. We aim to go there again for another event and look forward to it very much. I would recommend this hotel for any personal or business stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Jeslaf
Reviews.Content: Stayed for just one night but would go back and stay longer. Usually stay at the Hotel 1000, and this was a nice change. Stylish room with great, big windows, modern decor thoughtfully well-done, and the staff were SO service-oriented. Valet, front desk, restaurant, etc. All good! Location was SUPER. I felt like a local. Fireplace in lobby and breakfast on-site in restaurant was killer. Locals eating there looked like they enjoyed the food often. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, choose room carefully”
Reviews.Author: LJLtraveller
Reviews.Content: A centrally located well kept updated hotel in one of Seattle's older buildings. We were interested in the hotel because of the Northern Neighbour rate, which I couldn't book on the website, instead I phoned and they said the rate doesn't exist. We went with the parking package rate which seemed like a good deal, except when we arrived the room that went with the package was teeny, overlooking the lower rooftop and alley. We upgraded (by spending another $30 per night) to a suite on the 10th floor (top floor) overlooking Seattle streets which was lovely and worth it for a two night stay. Enjoyed the food at Lola's which was conveniently located off the lobby (one of the Tom Douglas Seattle restaurants) Also really enjoyed Dahlia, located across the street (again one of the Tom Douglas Seattle restaurants). The hotel is a block away from the shopping and othe downtown sites.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Seattle hotel with a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Jade M
Reviews.Content: We visited Seattle recently for our first time. We chose the Hotel Andra based on its location and the price. Upon arrival we were greeted at the front desk by a very friendly lady who got us checked in right away and gave us a map of Seattle. We were given a room on the 4th floor which had a view of the top of the Space needle, we were very pleased about that since we did not realize it could be seen from this hotel. We had a studio room which is their smallest, it was definitely small, but we knew that when booking, but the price was just very good on that particular room. The style of the room was very modern, as was the bathroom. The bed was very nice and comfortable, no problem sleeping after lots of walking in Seattle and hiking Mt Rainier one day. There is a chair and desk in the room, also another unit with a mini bar and coffee maker and more snacks on top, all of which are a little pricey. If you are wanting snacks for the room, check out the little grocery on the corner of the street, it's opposite the movie theater. We loved the bedside lamps in the room, we want some for our own bedroom. There is a flat screen mounted on the wall, and there are 2 bedside tables and a closet with a safe, we had just enough places to put all our things. Everything was extremely clean. The only complaint room wise was the walls seemed quite thin, and we had some noisy people next to us, sounded like they were throwing things around the room all the time. Luckily we were always so tired from our busy days that by the time we got in each night we had no problem going straight to sleep. The lobby of the hotel is very nice and cosy, it was rainy the first couple of days, and when you come in from the rainy and windy outside weather the lobby is very inviting. There were 2 different people always standing at the front door to open the door and greet the guests, the lady was always nice, but one man who always stood outside was never friendly, he seemed unhappy to be there, I can understand I don't always have a good day at work, but this was everyday that we saw him. The hotels location is great 10- 15 minutes from the Space needle,10 minutes from Pike place market, 20 - 25 minutes from the Washington ferries and Pioneer sq area and 5 minutes from the light link rail at westlake center. Restaurant and bar Lola is off of the lobby, they offer dining all day and also have a late night menu. Directly across the street is the Dahlia lounge, both are Tom Douglas restaurants, both have great food, but we preferred the atmosphere in the Dahlia lounge, you should definitely check out both of them while staying here. We had called for wake up calls 2 of the mornings we stayed here and we were not let down. At check out time we had the same lady who checked us in, she was very friendly. Everything was correct on our bill, and she asked if we enjoyed our stay, which we did. Overall we think this is a great hotel for visiting Seattle. We would recommend this to others and would even stay here again if we ever came back to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great stay.”
Reviews.Author: Liane B
Reviews.Content: I rely so much on trip advisor reviews, I finally decided to write one. My family and I stayed at hotel Andra for three nights in mid-September. We will be back in Seattle in two weeks, and we will not be returning to this hotel. There are a few redeeming qualities: we liked the location, it is a close enough walk to Pikes Place market. We loved the bakery across the street for a convenient breakfast, and the rooms were ample size for the four of us. We loved that the room has Voss water, although $3.50 a bottle, I really like that water. Downsides were many. the bed was so bad, there was a huge dip in the middle where literally, you had to either hover on the edge of the bed or roll into the big hole in the middle. My husband and I had the worst sleep ever. We complained, no change, no reply. Ditto about the shower. It did not drain. About three minutes into your shower and you are standing in ankle deep water. That to me, is disgusting. We asked three times for a plumber to fix it. No luck. It remained that way for our entire stay. Room service only has Greek food on the menu. It was from Lola's. It tasted pretty good, but way too limited in variety. Overall, it wasn't the worst place ever, but we expect good service and response, and a comfortable bed and nice bathroom are important to us, plus we order a fair amount of room service. So, overall there were just too many negatives and with many other great choices in Seattle, this one just isn't worth it.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: tbg1979
Reviews.Content: We arrived earlier than expected (11 am) and were going to leave the car and check in at the regular time (3 pm), but the staff checked and our room was ready ahead of schedule - perfect! The room was large, with a sofa, and desk, and plenty of walking space (we got the king room). The pillows were comfortable, as was the bed, and fellow travelers - major tip: join stash rewards, and you get free wifi (for the complaints about this from other reviewers - all you had to do was go to their website, they advertise it openly). finally, walking distance to pike place, great restaurants (sitka and spruce blew our minds), etc.

Reviews.Title: “good location but not like a Small Luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: prsmke
Reviews.Content: We have been in a couple of hotels that belongs to the Small Luxury Hotels and we have been really pleased with them, but Andra wasn't for us up to those standards. It is well located downtown Seattle, if you don't have a car. There are a lot of places you can walk to, even the Speace Needle isn't really far and you can take the monorail to come back. Restaurants like The serious Pie are just a block away. The bed was good, however our bedroom was very small, and the bathroom too but with modern finishes. It's not really a room to relax, just to go to sleep after a day of exploring the City. Our bedroom was at the end of the corridor, above of the restaurant's kitchen so we get the food smell (it was good) but the fans were noisy if you open the windows. They charge for wifi and parking is really expensive. We didn't have any incident but the service was not outstanding how it has been in the other Small Luxury Hotels we have stayed before.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, good location”
Reviews.Author: aggiebeth01
Reviews.Content: The rooms were nice and the beds very comfortable. The location is great. It's very easy to walk to many of the tourist attractions in the city, like the public market.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: dawntodero
Reviews.Content: We thought this hotel was beautiful. The location was great, we were able to walk to everything, very close to the space needle. The restaurant next door was very good too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little gem in a good location”
Reviews.Author: DoDowin
Reviews.Content: I decided to go with this hotel wtih the reviews I read here. The outside of the hotel does not look very fancy but the inside and the room was just superb. It has a good location and is very close to many attractions and bus transportation. Pike Place is just a few blocks away and you can definitely walk to the Space Needle. Make sure you join the Stash Hotel Reward to enjoy free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Management and Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: jagaroo
Reviews.Content: Key points are below: • When I booked the hotel (months ago and upon recommendation from a loyal hotel customer), I requested a early check-in on 9/3 because I knew we would need to get in early (climbed Rainier and was heading to Seattle early on Saturday) • When I called on Saturday morning to confirm the early check-in, there was no record of my request but I was told we could likely get in between 1-2 • We arrived at 1:30 and the room was not available – we went to get lunch and was told that we would receive a call as soon as the room was ready • We never received a call and when we arrived at 7 pm that night, the luggage had not been taken to the room • After waiting for the luggage to make its way to the room, my friend went to start getting ready and found someone else’s luggage in our room (our luggage had been taken to the wrong room and we had someone else’s stuff in ours) • We had to wait another 15 minutes to get our luggage and we were late to plans because of it • When I talked to Carmen, the Manager on duty, and expressed my concerns – she was nice and understanding and committed to giving us a free night’s stay AND breakfast for the four adults staying in the room every morning of our stay • Sunday morning, when we sat down at the restaurant next door to enjoy our breakfast, we were told she had not honored her agreement • I talked to Isaac and he said he would only give TWO of the four breakfast for one morning (totally different from what Carmen committed to) • Isaac was unprofessional and did not appear to care that we had already wasted time and energy on a stay that was terrible I could go on and on about Carmen and Isaac and their treatment of customers, but overall, wanted to share this feedback and make you aware of how unpleasant an experience it was when we were all trying to enjoy our Rainier celebration in Seattle. It is very unfortunate.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Location From Which to Explore Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Globalphile
Reviews.Content: I just returned from 5 nights in Seattle. I was really pleased with my choice of the Andra. Seattle is not the easiest place to navigate with so many neighborhoods. It was the perfect place for the Pike Place market, for the Seattle Museum, to walk to the Space Needle and Seattle Center and to the Seattle Museum's Olympic Sculpture Park. I even walked to Pioneer Square, the ferry to Bainbridge Island, Capitol Hill and the International District. It was close to the street car to the emerging South Lake Union area and close to the buses to Ballard and Fremont. My room was comfortable and bright. The front desk staff was very helpful with bus schedules, arranging a driver to the airport and with general restaurant recommendations. I ate at Lola downstairs 4 of my 5 mornings. The food and service were also very good. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for boutique hotel lovers”
Reviews.Author: NiigataTravelLover
Reviews.Content: I was originally planning to stay at Westin Seattle on my most recent business trip to Seattle as usual, but my business partner recommended this as he knows I love boutique hotels. Hotel Andra was just what I wanted, and it actually reminded me of some New York boutique hotels like Chambers, Shoreham, Hudson etc. which are my favorites, of course at a much more reasonable price. My room is a semi-suite room and had enough open space for me to do some workout. The bed and bathroom were very comfortable. I liked the lobby design and atmosphere too. The hotel restaurant Lola serves excellent breakfast and dinner with high quality local products. It is worth going to Lola during the trip to Seattle. I will come back to Hotel Andra soon and this will be my regular place to stay for sure.

Reviews.Title: “A little piece of heaven in Seattle!”
Reviews.Author: Agnes L
Reviews.Content: We recently took an overnight trip down to Seattle to take in a play. Initially we were hesitant in staying downtown because a) too many cars/too much traffic, b) downtown Seattle can feel a bit overwhelming and impersonal, and c) to get anywhere, one must get in their car and drive. Not having stayed at Hotel Andra before (or any new hotel for that matter) invoked some uncertainty as to how things will be. Hotel Andra changed these perceptions (much to our delight!) and exceeded our expectations of a boutique hotel. The warmth and friendliness starts the moment you pull your vehicle up to the front door, from the valets to the front desk reception. The front waiting area of the hotel is understated elegance and simple but yet exudes much comfort. The understated elegance and simplicity is carried forth in the rooms and overall in the hotel. We got a great hotel rate and stayed in the king suite, which was a comfortable size room. While it was a hotel room, it did not feel like a hotel room. It felt more like a comfortable personal space that one might have in their own home. But the wonderfulness of Hotel Andra does not stop there. Attached to the hotel is a place called Lola's, owned by a renowned Seattle chef. My husband and I had a drink there the afternoon we checked in and breakfast the following day. Both times, the service and food was impeccable and delicious! (I highly recommend the made-to-order donuts!) Location wise, Hotel Andra was a perfect spot for one wanting to close to downtown venues and activities. We were within walking distance to the 5th Avenue Theatre, Pike's Market, close to all the main shopping downtown and a whole lot more. It was actually really nice that we didn't have to drive around to different places. (Oh, and did I mention about a little bakery across from the hotel, the Dahlia Bakery? Delicious breads and "I'm in Tropical Paradise" triple coconut cream pies??) The only negative about the whole experience is that I can't find any negatives! (not that I am looking but usually there are always some...) So, there you have it. Hotel Andra is that little piece of heaven in Seattle! We can't wait for our next stay and outing at Hotel Andra/downtown Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “Smart, comfortable hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Shellsf
Reviews.Content: Desk staff was friendly, the contemporary decor was attractive and functional,and the beds were comfortable. Its a quick walk to downtown stores, the monorail and light rail system. There are good restaurants nearby, including the wonderful Lola's attached to the hotel. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Seattle atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Ennea
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Andra as a family. In an Andra Lux Suite. Well layed out, roomy, nice style. The hotel accommodates a lively croud, matching the clientele of the adjoining Lola restaurant. Great food there. Only minus are the very young and not very experienced front desk people. Let them stay in different rooms for the night, so they know what is what!

Reviews.Title: “Will be back!”
Reviews.Author: biccabons
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at the Hotel Andra. Nice room, location just about everything was nice! The parking is a bit steep, but this is downtown Seattle. The restaurant next door, Lola, is quite good. I guess my only complaint was the odd front desk staff. They were never rude, but I cant quite put my finger on what it was about them. They were a bit indifferent maybe? The concierge was invisible, we never saw him or her, just their unmanned desk. The decor is fun. I like the old feel of the room shape (there is an actual closet!) but the fixtures are all modern. I will stay here again but perhaps on a higher floor. The third floor was fine with the fan going. We didn't notice the traffic noise at all! Also next time, I will get better price on the room! While we were at the front a person called in and was quoted a price way lower than what we paid! I guess I should have pushed the issue then and there, but we had such a nice time I didn't want to rock the boat!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel w/ good location and great price”
Reviews.Author: Wailea_Traveler
Reviews.Content: My first time in Seattle and I was w/ a group on business for just 2 nights so I didn't choose the hotel. The rooms were spacious with a couch, but it felt awkward eating room service from the low coffee table since there was no table/chair. Instead there was a work counterop - which I loved because I could spread everything out. The Front Desk and Front Door staff were very helpful and genuine. I love to try the local cuisine when I travel so I felt really lucky at being within walking distance of Hot Pot donuts and several Tom Douglas restaurants. Lola's was in the Hotel and Dhalia Lounge and Dahlia Bakery across the street. I ate at Lola's 3 times, but that is another story I'm going to save for my separate post on Lola's. Convenience store was 3 blocks away and even though I didn't go, a group of people walked to Pike's Market and said it was nearby, but it was uphill. I'll just have to come back to Seattle on vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: PeteVa
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel on Tripadvisor and delivered exactly what we were looking for. We used their Town Car service from SeaTac which worked smoothly. Great service and nice room at the hotel. It's a short walk to all that downtown Seattle has to offer. Did not dine at Lola in the hotel, but looked like a great spot.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, great location, and lots of choices.”
Reviews.Author: kdsedward
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here to see the Mariners baseball game at Safeco Field and to do some downtown shopping. The staff was friendly and my check-in was very smooth and fast. I had called in earlier to request a room facing 4th avenue and I had no problems getting it. Our room was clean and we enjoyed the contemporary Nordic decor. Our bed was excellent and we had a relaxing sleep. Other reviews had noted problems with the street noise but the sound proof windows blocked most of the noise with exception of police/fire sirens (but that had happened maybe twice during our 3 day stay). The hotel was located two blocks from the light rail (to get to the game) and about 15-20 minutes from the Pike Place market. It was very accessible to other downtown attractions. and many different restaurants. We really wanted to take advantage of the different packages that the hotel offered (dinner, breakfast, and valet parking). I appreciated, Celcil the friendly Hotel Reservationist who provided me a breakdown of the packages and the promo for a comparison in helping me decide. We ended up using the early bird promo (30% off regular rate but be warned it's an advancement payment with no refund!). We did saved $200. We ate at the Dahlia Lounge (see my review). To get around the outrageous parking price, we used a combination of street parking (free all day Sundays and on Mon-Sat, it's free before 8am-8pm). There's a parking lot across the hotel that you can pay $12 for the whole day (see our picture) The parking system worked for us. On one day we took the car for the whole day and on the other day, we never used it.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: sadbuttru
Reviews.Content: We met some friends in Seattle to watch some baseball for the week-end. They picked the place to stay and it could not be better. Easy to get to the ball park, good places to eat and the ladys had fun shopping. Will always try to stay there again. Older but well done and has been updated. Very good staff.

Reviews.Title: “Is it me? Was I just unlucky?”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoSands
Reviews.Content: We received a good rate of $175 per night for a wedding. The rooms are spacious, compared to NYC. The toiletries are FACE stockholm and the towels are Frette. However, the service could use some extra training. It first started with the reception. She asked if I would like a map of Seattle. And she asked if I would like a key to the mini-bar. And she knew I was a guest of a wedding party. So, why did I end up going to my room without my map, key or the wedding info packet that everyone was supposed to receive? AND without my credit card!! I was preoccupied with getting my sister checked in that I didn't bother to follow up with the receptionist. And then when I asked her for the wedding packet, she picked up a stack of stuff on the front desk, looked underneath and then disappeared into the back room and then came back, picked up the stack again and found the pack. Our next interesting interaction involved the valet. We were coming home from the wedding friday late evening and decided to tidy up the car a bit before we went up to our room.
