When we all emerged from the car, I asked the valet, who was at his stand, if i should leave the key in the car, he said, "i wouldn't if i were you." without even looking up at me. Well, "where should i put it?' he requested that i bring the key to him. really? are you chained to your stand? unbelievable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: ParisLondonDubai
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Andra the night before starting a cruise. It was a really lovely hotel - clean, friendly staff, warm attractive interior design, convenient location - basically everything that you would want in a hotel. We also got a very reasonable rate booking the week we were to arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Spot- and wonderful room!”
Reviews.Author: MJM444
Reviews.Content: I was not familiar with Seattle when I booked this Hotel and was wonderfully surprised to find that it was located a short walk from most anywhere! It was a very sunny and beautiful week in Seattle so I was very fortunate. The room I received was on the 10th floor and was perfect. It had a small wet bar area and a sitting area that was great since some of my friends that live in Seattle came by for drinks before dinner. Bathroom was good size and had no tub. I don't need a tub so it was fine by me. The room also had a small walk in closet with a safe that was perect for putting away all of my valuables and messy luggage. The restaurant LOLA - in the lobby- was excellent. It made it difficult to go elsewhere though because it is so good and convenient. Finally, the staff was all very helpful, and efficient. The parking was not the best since they charge a hefty daily rate when right next door another hotel charges a fraction daily. (My friends that visited found that out the hard way) I did not need a car since I walked to the waterfront, museums and even the Space Needle. Exccllent place! I would stay there again, I need to find out the room number though, because I want that room again. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Felipe A
Reviews.Content: Nice stay, booked thru Travelocity who made a mostake in my room preference, staff tried to help, Heidi from sales and Viviana from front desk where extremely nice finding options for our meetings and helping with lost luggage from Continental. F

Reviews.Title: “Our number one choice hotel for a weekend getaway in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer R
Reviews.Content: We have lived in Seattle for almost 20 years and love to spend a night or two a couple times a year downtown. Needless to say, we have tried many hotels over the years and Hotel Andra has become our number one choice hotel for a getaway. The prime location, elegant and relaxing decor and impeccable hospitality make Hotel Andra our absolute favorite place to stay in Seattle. And added bonus... two of Tom Douglas' restaurants are right there. Lola is literally attached to the hotel and Dhalia Lounge is right across the street. We recently spent my husband's 40th bday at Hotel Andra and we couldn't have asked for a better evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jontydun
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Andra for two nights as part of our holiday. Great location in Belltown - easy to get around Downtown Seattle. Hotel rooms were good size and well maintained. There is a great bar/restaurant on ground floor - the staff were helpful and pleasant. Highly recommended!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Near perfection in hotel lodging”
Reviews.Author: fredo43
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Andra on the first and last day of our tour of Washington State. We chose the Andra because of a similar experience three years ago. Both of our rooms, the King Superior and the Deluxe Suite, on this trip were of a high standard--large, well-appointed, very comfortable, seemingly recently-painted, etc. The hotel staff were very pleasant and helpful during our stay and when I arranged reservations. We found one of the hotel restaurants, Lola's, to have very good food. The close proximity to the Pike Street Market and the art museum was also attractive to us. There is no question that this is where we will stay next time in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: tangerineplaid
Reviews.Content: Beautiful room, friendly staff, awesome location! Add to that delicious room service - what a combo!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel With An Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Wxtraveler
Reviews.Content: This is a rather nice hotel with an excellent location. This is not an overwhelmingly large property but not small either. This hotel was easy to find, but parking in the front to wait for the valet is limited and you may have to circle around until someone pulls out. Overall the room was a nice size, but the bathroom was tiny. The shower was interesting in that it had no door or shower curtain on it but rather a long glass wall with an opening. The sleep quality was among the best for the pillows and mattress at a hotel. Being in a city, you'll here the occasional ambulance go by at night and a noisy vehicle every now and then, but for the most part things were quiet. The bar/restaurant downstairs in nice but you are only a short walk to other places to eat as well as a small grocery store and a movie theater. This hotel is in a great location being between the Space Needle and the Public Market which are both an easy 15-25 minute walk (the market being closer). I did walk with a friend to Pioneer Square but it is a good 45 minute walk at the least. This is OK to do once, but if you are really desiring that area you may want to look for a place closer to there. The staff here was pretty good and friendly. For value, this is a bit based on the area. For downtown Seattle I gave it a 4 for value based on what I recall similar hotels going for in the area. However, being from Las Vegas, I would say this was a hotel on par with the Mirage or Treasure Island for room quality but charged room rates like the Wynn. So I can't give it a five on value, since while it is nice, this isn't a five star resort!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Seattle & Hotel Andra!”
Reviews.Author: suze71
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our first trip to Seattle. We had another "favorite ranked" hotel booked by the Market - but changed to Hotel Andra after reading reviews(and a better price). We loved everything about this hotel! They helped arrange a car to pick us up at the airport & greeted us by name when we arrived. Everyone was always courteous, helpful and had a smile. Our two room king suite was wonderful...comfortable bed, huge closets (so we didn't have to live out a suitcase for the week) and good amenities. The location was perfect for us - close enough to walk to Pikes Market, Seattle Center, and fabulous shopping! We had awesome dinners at Dahlias, Lolas, Serious Pie and Assagio...all just steps away. We absolutely loved Seattle - and will definitely stay at Hotel Andra on our return trip!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury chic in the heart of Seattle”
Reviews.Author: LinGrad
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights, what a gorgeous boutique hotel and within walking distance of just about every thing you might want to see in Seattle. The trip was even better armed with a stack of Groupons to use in the Seattle area - for places like the Smith Tower Observation Deck (very cool), dining in restaurants and visiting other attractions. The hotel lobby welcomes you after the drive to get there (or flight if you are so inclined). The staff is gracious and welcoming, and if you drive I highly recommend paying for the valet parking in their garage. Chances are you will never need your car, if you are like me. Pike's Place and the waterfront is just a short jaunt, as are the museums and great shopping and dining. The bed was everything you would expect in a luxury hotel, firm yet soft with bedding to die for. The bath is so luxurious you may never want to leave your room. There is also a hotel bar and restaurant with a legendary brunch. If you are looking for a romantic getaway or just want to treat yourself, this is the place to go in downtown Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy yet quaint”
Reviews.Author: MamacitaMorenita
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Seattle visit & 4-night stay at Hotel Andra. We had a 2-bed corner room on 4th floor facing 4th Ave (per request). The room & closet were both large. The modern bathroom was adequate with a large shower & lots of comfy towels. We appreciated the helpfulness of the doormen/women (especially Dustin). The location was exactly what we wanted - convenient to downtown (1 block from Macy's), light rail, Pike Place Market - yet part of a quieter neighborhood (Belltown). We easily walked to the Seattle Center & Space Needle, and to Myrtle Edwards Park & Sculpture Park on the waterfront. There were many restaurants & grocery stores within easy walking distance. Fortunately, we discovered nearby Top Pot Doughnuts on the last day or else we'd be several pounds heavier!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: melmar6
Reviews.Content: After a weeklong conference in Wenatchee, my husband met me in Seattle for a weekend getaway. We stayed at the Hotel Andra after reading reviews on TA. It was a fabulous hotel. The staff were very nice and helpful as we had never been to Seattle before. The hotel was in an amazing location -- we walked to Pike's Market, the space needle and all around downtown. The room was huge and had been recently renovated in a very modern style. The best part was the proximity to 3 of Chef Tom Douglas' restaurants. We tried all three -- The Dahlia Lounge, Serious pie and Lola, which is in the hotel. All were fabulous. Highly recommend the hotel and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: dtimd
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing stay at Hotel Andra this past weekend. The staff there was exceptional and super friendly. Lola restaurant on the lower level was also fantastic! Great breakfast! I will definitely be staying there next time I'm in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, noisy and smelly”
Reviews.Author: MarthaNY
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night after a long flight from NY. Took the suite for 350+vallet parking. The reason we choose Andra, is that they are advirtised as having the famous nordic Haestens beds. Staff didn't have a clue what I was talking about, of course no such bed in the room, and the girl I spoke to, never reached out to me to address my concern. Anyway, Suite has the bed lying in line with the front door of the room, needless to say , you can hear the world drunk or not return to their rooms late at night. Noisy !. Room faced the back where the ventilation system run non stop. Dont open the windows, noisy and a strong cooking smell will fill your room. I wonder what a normal guest room is like, when the suite is such ?! Never again Andra without the Haestens, even thou I luv Seattle. For that price, I stay at Four Seasons facing the water.

Reviews.Title: “December tradition”
Reviews.Author: FlyWriter
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Hotel Andra every December for a short city break. We've had a wonderful experience every time. The staff is always friendly and helpful. The one time we requested a room change, we were quickly accommodated. The rooms are modern, yet cosy, with nice linens on the bed and fluffy towels in the bath. The Andra is the perfect location for exploring downtown Seattle. Everything is within walking distance and anything further out is reachable by the monorail or light-rail. One year we took the monorail to the PNB Nutcracker and the next year we walked to Benaroya Hall for Handel's Messiah. A couple of tips: The Dahlia Bakery across the street has many of the same breakfast offerings as Lola, the hotel restaurant, at a fraction of the cost. My husband and I alternate who is going to run across the street to pick up breakfast and coffee and then we have a leisurely meal in our room while reading the complimentary paper. We park at the airport and take the light-rail into the city. No hassles with parking and certainly less expensive.

Reviews.Title: “a hotel gem!”
Reviews.Author: lkrocks
Reviews.Content: chose to stay at hotel andra the night before leaving on a cruise from pier 91. beautiful decor, large room, tremendously comfortable king bed. tremendous location and walking distance to waterfront, restaurants, etc. everyone in the hotel devoted to service. the restaurant in the hotel: "LOLA" is fantastic...make reservations in advance as it is packed.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel, average stay”
Reviews.Author: cag18
Reviews.Content: Following yet another US roadtrip, we spent out last night in the Andra - a hotel I had shortlisted via tripadvisor. The hotel is rather stylish, and we were greeted by generally friendly members of staff. Quickly on our way to the top floor room, as per my standard request at all hotels. Decent sized room, with a comfortable sofa, and nice king size bed. The GF enjoyed the little area she could sit to do her makeup, and I was very impressed by the fantastically designed toilet/shower room. One of the nicest I have seen in a long time. I read a lot of comments on tripadvisor about hotel shower pressure. Let me tell you - in the Andra, it might be TOO powerful! Very refreshing. The location of the hotel was very good. We managed to easily walk to all that we wanted. We prefer to walk around the neighbourhoods, to really get a feel for the places we are visiting, and we walked to and from the Space Needle in the evening after dark, with no issues at all. Easy. Area seemed very safe too. My only negative comment is that of noise. Yes, I know that the hotel is located in the middle of a city. But our room was located on the front side of the hotel, overlooking 4th Avenue. Even up on 10th floor and it remained very loud late into the Friday night, with sirens and loud vehicles. My GF had a tough time sleeping, and I was also woken a couple of times. Not what we needed the day before our 11 hour flight back to Europe. My tip to you all would be to demand a room on the rear of the hotel, away from 4th. I will absolutely consider this property next time I am in Seattle. But might ensure I have earplugs with me in case..!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: ldc20
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with friends, stayed at Hotel Andra a couple weeks back. It is nice hotel and reasonably priced. The rooms are smaller than they appear online and the bathrooms are tiny. However, they are nicely equipped and decorated. Staff was responsive. The "gym" is bascially a hotel room with a few pieces of equipment in it, so if you are looking for a great workout, look elsewhere. The location of the hotel is great and the restaurant was good. Overall, a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot in downtown Seattle!”
Reviews.Author: lorderic
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Andra! The service was impeccable and our room was great! They arranged our pickup at the airport which went well.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great Service, Great Room”
Reviews.Author: ExperienceTheWorld68
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very convenient to multiple areas in the city, and a reasonable walk to the waterfront and the market. The service was very welcoming, when asked if we wanted a key for the mini bar on check inn, I told them I did not need it. The lady then told me there was a nice store right down the street - this ended up being very convenient for us. They were very helpful in providing suggestions and directions around town. The rooms were modern, very clean, and unique - something that makes a hotel like the Andra just add to the overall vacation experience. Valet parking was expensive at $39.00, but there was not a lot of place to park, and the valet staff was outsanding as well. Tip - there is a Top Pot Donuts - a great little Seattle donut store down the street that is worth trying.

Reviews.Title: “Blind booking: Mom & I loved it”
Reviews.Author: verucavic
Reviews.Content: We decided to book this hotel for the 3 nights prior to a cruise leaving from Seattle. I made the reservation based primarily on other Trip Advisor recommendations, and we were not disappointed! The hotel was easy to find and walking distance from the train we took from the airport. The staff was professional, and our room was much more spacious than we expected with a large comfortable bed and sofa. The location of the hotel was ideal for exploring Pike Place Market and the waterfront. We especially liked the restaurant and several good spots for drinks and appetizers nearby. There is also shopping nearby, including a conveniently located Bed Bath & Beyond in case one has forgotten any vacation toiletries. The hotel was a very short taxi ride to the port/cruise terminal. All in all, we were not disappointed, but rather very pleased with the value and comfort this hotel provided.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the heart of Seattle!”
Reviews.Author: Teddi76
Reviews.Content: We went here for a mother/daughter get away. It was so convenient to everything we wanted to see. Great restaurants were right outside your door and shopping was a stone's throw away.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: JenS6
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our first trip to Seattle. The hotel is in a great location, it's in an easy to walk to the monorail, city center and pike market. We arrived hungry and way too early for check in. We asked one of the employees outside (I wish we had gotten his name) where we should go for lunch. After quickly describing what type of food we where looking for he pointed us to an amazing little restaurant. He was so friendly we immediately felt good about our choice of hotel. After lunch we wandered back and check in was quick and painless. Our room was clean and modern. Layout was much nicer than your standard hotel. Robes where very comfortable. My only complaint is that some light is let into the sleeping area of the room at night. The lights in the hall are very bright and shine in all around the door. We had to lay a towel down to block most of it out. We also could not find a way to turn off the under-shelve lighting in the bathroom, so if the bathroom door slid open the room was bathed in a blue light. That being said, we slept great, the bed and linens are so comfortable! Check out is at 1:00, and that gave us plenty of time to have breakfast and explore pike market and the aquarium before we needed to be out. Check out was just as easy as check in. This will be our go-to hotel for future trips to Seattle. We Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: VanceOTR
Reviews.Content: We are Seattle fans and have traveled often from Florida over the past 10 years. This hotel by far is our new home away from home. From Virginia at the front desk to John behind the bar at Lola, this is a true Seattle Home experience. The staff is well trained, and they respond to any issue with professionalism and a sincere demeanor that just makes you feel good about spending money to sleep. We started a two week trip at Hotel Andra and then changed the end of the trip to stay with them longer. Great location, great rooms, great service, and great food but most of all great smiles. STAY AT THIS HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ed8
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with friendly staff. Clean modern rooms, comfy beds, free starbucks coffee in the room and a pair of bathrobes to lounge and watch recently released movies on the large flatscreen. LoLa restaurant next to the lobby serves a great eggs benedict. Serious pie (100 yards away) has an excellent octopus salad in addition to their famous pizza. Dahlia restaurant across from the hotel has copper river salmon (when in season) + their bakery next door makes a mean coconut cream pie. All restaurants appear to embrace the farm to table concept. Forget the rental car (parking fee is ridiculous) and take the light rail from sea-tac airport to Westlake shopping mall. Its about a 30min ride and a ten minute walk to the hotel. Hotel is close to all but far enough from the crowds. 15 min walk to pioneer square or the seattle needle. Most bars/clubs are about a 10 min walk. We came up for the Mariners game and the U2 concert. The stadiums are walkable but you may want to use a taxi or the light rail from the westlake mall if you are too pooped. Tip: the hotel entices you with lots of treats in the room. Skip it and walk one block to Ralphs market and stock up with drinks and snacks instead.

Reviews.Title: “Really good funky design hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: RJ-EM
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in May 2011 at the start and at the end of our three week trip through Alaska. Despite being a non-smoking room, our room on the first night smelled like it had been occupied by smokers previously. When we mentioned this to reception at check out in the morning they apologised profusely and immediately upgraded us to a bigger room for our return three weeks later. You would expect this from a good hotel, but, when we came back three weeks later, not only did we get the upgraded room, there was also a message from the manager waiting for us, thanking us for letting them know about the issue. We thought this was a nice personal touch. We also made a local call from our room but the hotel waived the charge and despite it not being a big amount, it is nice to see there are still hotels out there that don't try to milk you for money at each and every occasion. The Italian restaurant next door (Assagio) is excellent for dinner and the bar next to the hotel (Lola) does a good breakfast. All in all this is a very funky looking hotel with fantastic service in an excellent location. I don't think we would want to stay anywhere else in Seattle than in the Andra next time we are back in town.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, immaculate, great staff, location, and even a great value. Book it!”
Reviews.Author: JMaxPhoto
Reviews.Content: Our third time personally staying at the hotel, but we have also put many family and friends in the Andra and not a single one was not happy. First and foremost, the staff is what makes the place (you know, like excellent bread makes the sandwich!). I've seen the lobby packed with check-out visitors nervous about making their cruise ship departures or whatever destination, and the front desk and entry staff just stay poised and deliver calming service. Second, while the hotel can handle your business/event needs (especially in the multi-level/multi-nook main room), I especially love the fact that the vibe is NOT business, but personal. Even some smaller hotels don't pull this off as well. The lobby sitting areas and the great transition to the Lola Lounge/Restaurant make you feel like you are already "out at a cool place." Third, the rooms are decorated in a very subdued, yet crisp, color palette that is just plain comforting. The beds are great and the towels (Frette) are just awesome and don't have that overwashed and bleached feeling. I could go on, but I'll leave some things to surprise you. If you need/want to go visit Seattle; do yourself a favor and stay here. Oh, but lastly, the rates (even for suites) are reasonalbe, especially compared to other hotels in downtown seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: SquaraJean
Reviews.Content: After a long day of flight delays and missed connections walking into the Andra was such a relief. Every staff member we encountered during our three day stay was friendly and helpful, and the room was extremely clean and spacious. On top of great rooms and service, the Andra's location seemed ideal, and happy hour at Lola was excellent. The only thing that would have improved our stay was complementary wifi, but we will be staying at the Andra again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel on great location - great value!”
Reviews.Author: aMid-aSmi
Reviews.Content: Nice large room, nicely furnished with very comfy bed. Bathroom nIce, with proper walk in shower, but no bath (fine by me). Nice big walk in wardrobe, which was great for hiding away all the cases to leave a clutter free room. Great central location means all the main sites are in walking distance, so all in all a great place to stay. Really is excellent value for money. One minor thing, no free Internet in the room just in the bar. One final thing, we rarely eat in hotel restaurants as they generally aren't up to much. But the Andra's bar and restaurant were both packed with locals, so on the third night we were there we tried it. Highly recommended!! Food and atmosphere were great!! Would stay here again if we go back to Seattle and didn't want to splash out on Hotel 1000!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel ranks among my favorites world-wide”
Reviews.Author: steljeda
Reviews.Content: I'm a little late to write a review, but we're coming back at the end of the month and what better recommendation is that? I first stayed at this hotel a few years ago when I was in Seattle for business Monday - Friday, since then I've been back several times for pleasure. And what a pleasure it is! The staff is courteous, friendly and helpful. They treat you beautifully whether a frequent guest of first time resident. The location is great: close to the Pier and Space Needle as well as other less touristy attractions and among wonderful restaurants (the Lola serves some great fare as does the Dahlia across the street; the Icon Grill around the corner is also a nearby favorite). The rooms (I usually choose a King Superia) have a light, airy feeling without being impersonal. I have wonderful memories of drinking tea/coffee in the morning on the couch with my husband, hotel robes on looking out the large window and reading the NY Times or having wine and room service snacks in the room with friends before heading out for the evening. The bed is extremely comfortable, the room is well appointed (complimentary paper, coffee and tea; nice bath products; comfortable robes; good variety of drinks/snacks for purchase; etc.) and you just can't help but feel you've come "home" after a day out. Even when friends have offered us their guest room we politely decline as we consider staying at the Andra a vital component of our Seattle vacations. Reasonably priced my husband and I like this place so much we are detouring to the Andra on the way to Portland to celebrate his 40th birthday. Looking forward to spending another night at this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Seattle's Most COMFORTABLE BEDS!”
Reviews.Author: ctripper
Reviews.Content: I am a heavy traveler who takes 20+ trips per year, all for pleasure, none for business. I must say this was one of the best hotels I have stayed at. The bed was exceptionally comfortable and the small touches like free newspapers, the under-cabinet nite-lite in the bathroom, comfy bathrobes, and the Tivoli alarm/radio were fantastic. Most luxury hotels provide upscale toiletries and a superb minibar, but the Andra seemed to go beyond this with extra comfy goosedown pillows and a really wonderful mattress! I slept like a baby! And the common areas like the lounge downstairs and the fireplace are really comfortable and make you want to come back to the hotel to hang out! Lola Restaurant is attached and Dahlia Lounge and Serious Pie (BEST brick oven pizza) are across the streeet, plus the reasonable parking next door make this place perfect! The price was also VERY reasonable, about 30% cheaper than comparable hotels nearby in the same district. Staff was extra friendly and helpful and gave us free wifi access. I am definitely recommending this hotel and my mother (who stayed with me) has already decided to come back on her next trip to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, chic and well-located”
Reviews.Author: KateKirk
Reviews.Content: The Andra was comparable in location/style to several Kimpton properties in Seattle but better priced. Four restaurants within eyesight of the front door + more within blocks = very convenient. The staff were very helpful when Seattle was hit by a rare snowstorm and we had to do some juggling of our reservations. We stayed twice over a 10-day period and the first room was pretty snug and on a noisy street, but the second was much roomier and quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Just as good the second time”
Reviews.Author: abott
Reviews.Content: Hotel Andra was recommended by a close friend in 2005 - our stay at that time was just wonderful. Six years later we are back at the Andra... and it is just as good as it was in 2005. The rooms are spacious and comfortable with trendy modern furnishings. The hotel staff are so friendly and helpful. The hotel restaurant 'Lola' is a great place for brunch on the weekend (breakfast during the weekend is good too!). There are so many great restaurants in the local area within close walking distance. If you prefer to stay close, gives Lola's a go for dinner - you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room in a great location”
Reviews.Author: md6405
Reviews.Content: Was here for business, but also a bit of sightseeing. The location of the hotel was perfect for both. Very close to the light rail for easy and cheap transportation to/from the airport, close to Pike's Peak and countless and varied eating options. Room was very large.

Reviews.Title: “Hip Hotel for Foodie”
Reviews.Author: Riamiller
Reviews.Content: Uber, hip boutique hotel. Great lobby and even better restaurant. There are four words to describe Seattle. The first two is Pikes Place, the other two is Tom Douglas. If you stayed here, you would be able to access some of the best, if not all the best dining establishments--on foot. Everything from Mac and cheese at Beechers to sea food at Ettas, peanut butter cookies at Dahlias, pizza at Serious Pie and drinks at Lolas. All within a 10 minute walk from The Andra. Like they say in Seattle, NIRVANA.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: Ryan080
Reviews.Content: Everything was first rate from start to finish. Initially, what drew me to the hotel was the location and affordability. The service was outstanding, and the location of the hotel made it very easy to hit all the spots my family and I wanted to see. If I ever decide to travel back out to Seattle, the first thing I will do is book a room at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and beautiful rooms.”
Reviews.Author: CheChoui
Reviews.Content: Wonderful boutique hotel experience. Gorgeous Icelandic decor. Restaurant on site, Lola's, is amazing and we ate there every day.

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect but enjoyable nonetheless”
Reviews.Author: A_Mariner
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently visited Seattle over the President's day (in the US) holiday. We are Canadian (from Vancouver) but enjoy visiting our neighbour to the south periodically. It was our first visit to the Hotel Andra and we booked a "Lux" suite with a separate bedroom and pullout couch. The suite was OK in size, not large but adequate and nicely refurbished. The bathroom is a little small but totally functional. It has the "boutique hotel" feeling. The location is excellent, within walking distance of most of the downtown sites and some excellent restaurants. In fact, every meal that weekend was a "Tom Douglas" (a well known restaurateur in Seattle) event. The restaurant in the hotel is Lola while Serious Pie and Dahlia Lounge are across the street. The first night was room service by Lola & Serious Pie. Fabulous (if pricey) room service. Breakfast (both mornings) at Lola were remarkably good as well. The octopus, bacon, brussell sprout, parsnip hash (aka Tom's Big Breakfast) sounds extremely odd but tastes fantastic (serious umami factor for breakfast)! Serious Pie makes some the best pizza I've ever tried and the food/service at Dahlia Lounge was very good and accommodating to our 3 & 5 year old sons. The service at the hotel was professional but slightly less than warm and welcoming (I suspect that having our two little guys in tow was slightly off-putting for the staff given that their presence may undermine the skinny-fabulous-fashionista demographic that most boutique hotels are hoping to attract). Nonetheless, they did not seem to have any difficulty with my credit card. My wife and I have travelled a lot and have stayed at a diverse range of hotels -- everything from 2000 sq ft presidential suites in major cities like Shanghai & San Francisco to less than stellar dives in cities with limited options (or when we were students). I appreciate hotels than understand who they are trying to serve and focus on their target clientele versus trying to please everyone and ultimately achieve mediocre/poor results. I think if you're single, travelling as a (youngish) couple or are in town on business and are looking to stay downtown at a reasonable cost (we paid USD161 plus tax) and don't need a Ritz Carlton/Four Seasons type of experience, you would be quite happy staying here. Location/restaurant options are excellent. Service and accommodations are pretty reasonable given their target clientele and the cost of the rooms. My wife & I would be happy to stay here again if we were travelling without the kids. With the kids, we would be more likely to stay here if they could stay in an adjoining room (not sure if they are available here) and if they were a little older.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff/valet... great location & rooms”
Reviews.Author: martinej11
Reviews.Content: This "small luxury" property is located close to good restaurants including Long's Vietnamese and Serious Pie. The rooms are modern and eight foot mirrors in the king suite make for interesting conversation - the upgrade from superior queen is worth it. Despite the aesthetics, our upgrade and checkout staff were incredible rude which was unfortunate given our stay was for Valentines. For example, after getting a cold checkout my partner and I waiting outside for a valet to get our car key which was already parked up front. After five minutes of waiting in the cold, I returned to the desk and asked the clerk to call the valet - attitude, no apology for inconvenience and to add further insult to injury she hadn't called herself despite seeing us waiting. The valet was equally rude and handed me my keys with a "here" - no thank you, no do you need directions, no look forward to seeing you again. I'd take staff friendliness over fancy toiletries any day. Chose another.

Reviews.Title: “Beware Free Parking Promo”
Reviews.Author: Hadlock
Reviews.Content: This is a good mid-range hotel in downtown Seattle. Modern furnishings in clean rooms are a plus. Andra promotes "free valet parking" when booking best available rate thru internet or direct with hotel. Upon check-in I was advised that parking would be +$39.00 since I booked "early rate" rather than best available. I thought the early booking rate was the best available. Apparently not so. Best available rate is actually $41.00 more than early booking. Sounds like the old doublespeak "up 10%, down 10%" flim-flam sales promo. I was totally confused and told check-in agent that this web site is misleading. The desk agent did the right thing however and agreed not to charge us the $39. We would not have taken our car if this was relatively clear. Hopefully Andra will "correct" this so others do not fall into the dilemna we had. Other than that incident, I would definetely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC SEATTLE HOTEL EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: PDXTraveler97213
Reviews.Content: We just spent the most fantastic weekend at the Hotel Andra in downtown Seattle. We travel relatively frequently and Seattle always makes for a great romantic get-away weekend, which typically includes shopping, dining and clubbing. We've stayed in a variety of hotels in Seattle (often selected by Hotwire or Priceline because you can get some great deals using both) and while most of them have been "nice," none of them have ever just blown us out. As I wanted this weekend to be extra-special, I decided to do research and book directly thru the hotel. My final selection was a suite the Hotel Andra. Wow! What a fantastic find. From the staff, to the decor, to the room size, it was perfection in every way. It was a front corner suite with loads of light and great views of the active neighborhood. We were not bothered by street noise, as a number of people had reported. About the only bad thing I could find was an area of common complaint in other reviews: The bathroom is small and poorly lit. We brought a floor lamp in from the living room for extra light. This is not saying that it wasn't stylish - it was quite stylish. it was also small and dark. There's not much they can do about the size (old building) but some additional light would be nice. The service was exceptional and anything we wanted or needed was taken care of perfectly. When Lola, one of two restaurants in the hotel, was packed, we called downstairs and had a table waiting in short order. Lola was the other great find of the weekend, by the way. What a great restaurant. We had both dinner and breakfast there and both were REALLY good. Back to the hotel. We arrived at 4pm intending to relax, go out to dinner and then head out to some clubs for the night. We didn't leave the hotel until 2pm the following afternoon. Between the fantastic suite, the great bar and two top restaurants, there was no reason to leave the building!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travellerisrael
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for 4 days during January and had a good experience. Flexibility - I ordered a room for 5 nights and had to cancel the first night on short notice and they did that without a problem. Location - the location is Ideal for Seattle. It is right in the middle of everything, 5 minutes walk from pike place market and very close to all means of public transport. getting there from the Airport is very easy - just 3 minutes walk from the westlake station of the link light rail (2.5$ for the entire 40 minutes journey - just a waste to take a cab). It's true that like every big city there are quite a bit of homeless around but I guess that is true for all of downtown Seattle, and in my opinion it is actually worse around pioneer square a few blocks to the south. Lola restaurant, one of Tom Douglas's (the local celebrity chef) restaurant is at the hotel and Dhalia lounge, bakery and serious pie, three of his other restaurants and bakeries are across the street, so you will never go hungry even if you don't want to leave your room. Staff - I only had contact with them during check in and out which were fast and efficient. the bell boys/valet always smiled at you and were always very polite. room - the room was spacious, nice, and had all the amenities you would expect to find at such a hotel. the only annoying thing is you had to pay for the WI-FI access. the exercise room was small but sufficient. The decor of the hotel is very Nordic and the lobby is very inviting. I also had quite a good deal reserving a long time ahead but generally speaking it's not a cheap hotel. All in all a very nice, central good hotel. I would consider staying there again in my next visit to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: NMskies62
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. It is centrally located in downtown Seattle and close to wonderful restaurants and attractions. Our room was spacious, comfortable, quiet and very state of the art. The hotel staff were very friendly. Room service as always was very pricey.

Reviews.Title: “A treat that is always reliable, dependable anbd luxurious”
Reviews.Author: badEXPEDIA
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel through many of its incarnations starting with the time when it was the Hotel Claremont. It has changed/grown into one of the premier hotels in Seattle. It is in one of my favorite areas of Seattle, Belltown, and right across the street from the Dahlia Lounge. And it now includes another Tom Douglas restaurant on the first floor of the hotel itself---an especially a great spot for breakfast. The rooms are well appointed with most of your needs anticipated; however , the staff will try and help you secure what extras you feel you need. I anticipate my Seattle trips because of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for Shopping Downtown”
Reviews.Author: BIG_neutrino
Reviews.Content: Room: Suite Staying: Spouse w/ 3 year old Hotel Andra was a perfect stay for our downtown holiday shopping trip. It is two blocks away from Westlake Center and Macy's. The suite was great. The excellent view, room decor, furniture and amenities met our expectations. The service exceeded expectations, and are the reason we will definitely stay at the hotel again in the future. The evening room service was great: Upon our return from a night out, the room was serviced with adjusted lighting, soft music playing and the bed readied. Nice touch. It is refreshing to stay at a lifestyle hotel that is unique in character while retaining superior room decor, amenities and service. The complimentary NY Times was appreciated. I would have liked free wi-fi access in the suite. There is free wi-fi in the lobby, but the tethered internet connection was $10/night. No thanks.

Reviews.Title: “A very Nice Room & A Very Nice Price! Right Downtown!”
Reviews.Author: shotbadly
Reviews.Content: We live near Seattle and wanted to have a nice weekend in town. It's a better idea than driving in Seattle traffic more then we'de like. I researched many hotels in the downtown area and some were just out of buget for this sort of trip. We booked the Hotel Andra and were quite surprised with the spacious room, the updated decor and the style of the room was very cool. All designer furniture and art on the walls. Our room was more square than a traditional hotel room with a window nook near the desk. It felt like a studio apt.! The bathroom is small but the shower is large. There is a built-in vanity for the ladies to put on their make up or ? This made up for the small bathroom. We were on the top floor which is the 10th and it was quiet through the night. Lola is the restaurant on site and room service was fantastic!The location is outstanding! A few blocks from Pacific Place, Nordstroms etc. We paid $209.00 for the King size bed room.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: English_Setter
Reviews.Content: We live in Seattle and stayed here after a holiday party. I stay in hotels 75 days a year and this was one of the best in years - and a fantastic value. Great food in the hotel and nearby. Fantasic staff and fantastic room. Can't recommend this place enough.

Reviews.Title: “The bed was nice”
Reviews.Author: jgg017
Reviews.Content: It is a lovely looking hotel and the bed (Hastens) is fabulous. Also, great location - one of the major draws. The staff were just "okay" when we checked in, but could have been better considering they screwed up our reservation. Our issue was with the non-existent stay 3 and pay for 2 night deal they advertised (http://hotelandra.com/packages/stay-3-pay-2/). In the end, we paid for 3 nights in a extremely expensive room and they graciously took $40 off the bill. I even left a note when I booked online to confirm the deal and rate, which they didn't. Would I stay again? Probably not. There are better deals in Belltown.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Andra”
Reviews.Author: clapton1
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Andra a few times now and can't say enough positive about this hotel. The staff is helpful & attentive, the location is fabulous (Belltown between downtown, Capitol Hill & Queen Anne), close to wonderful places to eat (Lola, Serious Pie, Wild Ginger, Top Pot Doughnuts) & a number if tourist sites (Pike's Market, Pioneer Square, etc.)

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel but internet access is a cash grab”
Reviews.Author: NoMoreSnuggles
Reviews.Content: My SO and I checked in for an extended long weekend and got a really good promo price that included valet parking (normally $39/night). The room was spacious for the price we paid and the location was extremely convenient. One great perk is room service available from both the hotel restaurant Lola and the super delicious Serious Pie (as well as baked good from across the street at Dahlia Bakery). Staff was friendly overall (front desk was hit and miss). The door to our room seemed improperly seated and, everytime someone passed by the room, it sounded like they were trying to get in. My quibble is with the internet access. Seattle is a tech city. We are techies and are fine with paying a fair price for internet access. The hotel's stated price was $10/day. Only after trying to get on did we learn that this price was per device. Between our laptops, iphones and other devices, that would have meant $50/day for internet access. In an age of wireless-enabled laptops, ipads, smartphones, ipods, cameras, etc the per device pricing feels like a ridiculous gouge - and definitely not stated up front.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Attentive Staff”
Reviews.Author: BruinSeattle
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I live in Seattle and we chose Hotel Andra to recommend to our out of town wedding guests. We thoroughly researched the options, but being Seattle natives we put Hotel Andra on our short list of the best hotels in the city due to its location, amenities, and service. The hotel is located in a great part of the city - walking distance to all the best tourist spots (Pike Place Market, downtown shopping, Space Needle, Experience Music Project, Seattle Art Museum, etc.). The hotel restaurant is one of Tom Douglas' and it has a great northwest menu. The rooms are beautiful, the prices are good, and you can avoid paying for parking at the hotel by doing a day rental from one of the multiple car rental sites located within a few blocks. All of our guests - from our 90 year old grandmother to our college-age cousin - loved the hotel. If you are looking for a hotel to recommend to your wedding guests, Kelsey Hunsinger is amazing to work with and will take great care of you. If you are looking for a hotel for yourself, definitely check out this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very nice option in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: researchernow
Reviews.Content: This hotel was roomy, clean and very conveniently located.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and wonderful restaurant”
Reviews.Author: TravelingWildMan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is within walking distance of downtown and Pike St. market. The restaurant is very good - would recommend reservations for breakfast and dinner. I thought Tom's Big Breakfast was fabulous; but my traveling partner couldn't visualize squid in the morning (too bad!). The hotel is a couple blocks from East Lake mall, which is at the end of the light rail from the airport, and the start of the monorail to Seattle center. Taxis are always available if the distance or rain gets intimidating. The rooms are very comfortable and the bathrooms unique with a Northern European feel - simple and elegant. No bath tub (Queen room); but I loved the bathroom mirrors that didn't fog up! There's no sheet per se on the bed; so you might keep that in mind if you're with someone who needs more temperature regulation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable rooms and chic lobby/resto do not justify the room rates.”
Reviews.Author: 1000Larch
Reviews.Content: Something is seriously out of whack when people are willing to pay upwards of 200 bucks a night for a basic hotel room in an old building that clanks and groans all night long and offers little more than snappy furnishings, a good bar and location. We've been staying in this same hotel for decades, through numerous incarnations, but we just can't see paying twice as much as we used to for a room that is basically the same old room, with a few cosmetic changes. Much better deals are to be found elsewhere in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Serious Neglect and safety issues.”
Reviews.Author: lolitalost
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to staying at the hotel Andra, We usually stay at the 4 seasons but they didn't have anything available to fit our family during our trip. So after extensive searches I came accross hotel andra. I was promised a "Suite" with accomadations enough for us and our 2 small children. Our room was not ready till after 6pm, then when we got settled into our room my 4 year old son found drug paraphanalia on the floor in front of the couch. When my partner went down to talk to the manager, they didn't really act like it was a big deal. My partner works for the department of justice and really tried to press the severity of a little kid coming accross drugs in our room. So after dinner we go back up to our room to set the kids up with a movie in the living room, and the TV doesn't work, so we all end up in the main bedroom with the kids watching a movie. Instead of having the tiny amount of space we were supposed to have. The next day they offered a free movie rental, which really doesn't make up for a ruined night. I was really bummed about the whole experience, I really was expecting more from the staff. One good thing I can say, is that the Valet guys were really really nice.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Kangavik
Reviews.Content: o suite was poorly furnished with cheap mirrors and uncomfortable sofa o tiny bathroom o felt like an old hotel in need of refurbishing o noisy due to nearby building works o got the feeling from the staff that this hotel would prefer their clientele to be business people and not tourists o room service trays left in hallway for very long periods (eg all day)

Reviews.Title: “Gain piece of mind booking your reservation with Hotel Andra”
Reviews.Author: Lagirdam
Reviews.Content: If you are like me, you are searching the internet for the best hotel value - search no more. My wife and I celebrated our 10 year anniversary in Seattle and of course wanted it to be as special as possible. From reservation to check-out, we have nothing but great feedback. Upon arrival, we were greeted outside as we arrived by taxi by the door person who graciously loaded our luggage onto a bell cart and assured us our luggage will be sent to our room once we check in - and it was. The front desk agents were attentive to our needs and answered our questions as we thought of them and check in was flawless - we stayed in a corner Lux suite on the 10th floor. Upon entering our room, I have a habit of checking the entire room to make sure it is cleaned and everything works. I have to say, I was extremely impressed by the overall cleanliness and attention to detail, so kudos to the guest room attendants who keep this room clean. Not an ounce of dust to be found, amenities set up to perfection. Furthermore, as we ventured out into the city each day, our room was 'reset' just as though we were arriving for the first time and let's not forget about the daily turndown service! Throughout our stay as we entered and exited the hotel, the staff always smiled at us and genuinely looked like they wanted to be there and that speaks volumes. This hotel goes beyond just a room and a place to sleep. For us, it enhanced our week-long stay in Seattle and we are already talking about booking our next stay at Hotel Andra.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was a polished gem in downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: chris_luxton
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week at this hotel for a conference held at the Bell Harbor Conference Center. From the moment I walked in, it felt like home. The staff was extremely courteous and the hotel was modern but very comfortable. We took away every ounce of value in the room costs. The guest rooms were beautiful and so well furnished and arranged. They had a comfortable bed with a down comforter, a couch and coffee table, a sink and counter space with coffee maker and, of course, Starbucks coffee and Tazo teas. The service was exceptional. For example, one night I asked the front desk for some earplugs and after about 10 minutes the concierge showed up at my room with a small store bag with some earplugs that they must not have had in house and had to run out to the store to get. This was completely unexpected but the service shown in this gesture was greatly welcomed. Also, on the day we left for the airport at 7 a.m., we asked the front desk to get us a taxi. Instead they had arranged for a town car service for less money than what we would have paid for a cab. Here are a few other details that impressed me the most about this hotel: Beautiful bathroom with a great shower Cotton balls and q-tips in a glass container was a nice touch Makeup counter and nook with lighted mirror Anti-fog mirror in the bathroom The softest, most wonderful robes Door and concierge service Complimentary umbrellas to use on those rainy Seattle days Business center with printers and paper (no charge) They have an amazing lounge and lobby area with a fireplace that invites you to sit and visit with your friends and colleagues in a great, quiet setting. This hotel was everything I could have wanted and more. I will stay nowhere else when visiting Seattle. The Hotel Andra is now my Seattle home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Andra met all of my needs particularly as a solo traveler”
Reviews.Author: planet154
Reviews.Content: I stayed one entire week at the Hotel Andra & I had a blast; it was my 1st time to Seattle & I was very impressed; the hotel was centrally located to all of the fun/points of interest; the staff made me feel extremely welcome and always had recommendations for things for me to do which was extremely important as I was traveling alone. I will definitely stay at this hotel again; it's not real fancy like some of the hotels I stayed in for business but it's got a cool, hip vibe that I liked and it was clean; I highly recommend it as a great place to stay for business or leisure. I'm pretty picky when it comes to staying in nice hotels and this made the grade for me.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Hotel with Class”
Reviews.Author: MFM14
Reviews.Content: Traveling with my Wife, 11month son and my Mom. Mom had the small room but at an excellent value. My Wife, Son and I had a larger room at the front of the hotel on the 5th floor. The hotel accommodated my Son with a crib at no extra cost. Recently remodeled with nice finishes and classy touches. My wife is in love with the bathroom, so much so that she has pictures of it. The room was very spacious even with the crib. It was a very quiet room with a small fridge and large flat screen television (with inputs to watch your day's videos). Location is perfect, a short walk to Pike Market, bus/train station, corner market, shopping, everything, etc and was why we first chose it in the first place. Across the street is a scrumptious bakery which we could smell from our windows. Downstairs is the hotel's really cool restaurant and bar. Reception and the staff had friendly dispositions and helpful walking directions. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Remarkable Service, Fantastic Rooms, Memorable Experience”
Reviews.Author: BusinessEnthusiast
Reviews.Content: We chose Hotel Andra in Seattle for our Business Summit over other Hotels in the area for many reasons and it resulted in a huge success. The meeting room was just the right size for our group and we as well as our attendees who stayed, felt that the experience was all about us. The staff was very attentive and responsive. The accomodations were wonderful, everyone loved the Hotel Andra and the rooms. The food was a huge hit! From the appetizers, to the lunches, and evenings at Lola, everyone made us feel that the Hotel Andra was ours for the entire duration of the Summit. We will return to Hotel Andra for our meetings when in Seattle. Hotel Andra is to be commended for making us feel special right from the time we pulled into the valet area. Even after we checked out, many of us stayed late in the day to see the sights and the Hotel staff kept our things safely locked up and never hinted of any inconvenience even when some of us returned past midnight. Great job! You get high marks from us. Thank you Hotel Andra staff!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice change of pace. Not your "typical" hotel.”
Reviews.Author: rcooper1122
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Hotel Andra 4 nights while visiting Seattle. The location could not be better. Anywhere downtown is within walking distance and the light rail and monorail are only a few blocks away. The front desk was alway polite and the guys working the door were always welcoming. The room was much nicer than any "cookie cutter" hotel room. The decor was very updated and everything was always kept very clean. For the money in Dowtown Seattle, I would say it was a very good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel at relatively low price”
Reviews.Author: PommeDeGuerre
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a business trip to Seattle where I had to keep nightly rates at or below $200. A colleague whose taste in hotels is a little richer than mine recommended the place, and I was surprised it was within my allowed budget. The hotel is very nice. Solid, masculine, yet very plush feeling. Sort of Pacific Northwestern-meets-Scandi-chic. My room was incredibly spacious, with a desk, wet bar, couch, and large bathroom. Staff was friendly, fast, courteous. Helped me find directions to where I needed to go. Offered an umbrella for the night when it started to rain. No negatives here. I would give it five stars, but I think I'd have to reserve that for a truly world-class bank-breaking hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Group opts for comfort, style, location, hospitality-and finds it”
Reviews.Author: caterinade
Reviews.Content: We booked a block of rooms for a Labor day weekend wedding with guests staying 2-4 days. This was easy and convenient and ensured an excellent rate for our friends and family. Hotel Andra has beautiful large, quiet rooms. Ours looked over busy 4th avenue, but the large window was framed by trees giving us a treehouse kind of view. We had a "handicapped adapted "room with a roll- in tile shower. The bathroom worked well with nice amenities with a slight caveat that the lighting not quite bright enough for my taste. There was, however, a framed full length mirror in the bed-sitting area that was perfect for dressing and last minute details. The linens and bedding were new and high quality with a great king size bed as standard and our room sported a huge walk in closet.We saw several other rooms in our party and they were similar in quality and style. Service was excellent both courteous and friendly. This is a bustling hotel on a big weekend and our group made frequent extensive use of the lobby seating area and ate at several of the Andra related restaurants including the one in the hotel itself. We were always treated with respect and prompt attention by all employees from the valet parking attendants to the front desk staff. This hotel has a great location within a short walking distance to the best things about downtown Seattle. Our New York family loved this accessibility. Only one small criticism and this came from a number of our group and that was the lobby area euro techno music. Yes , this is a hip hotel with a definite European ambiance but maybe the music could be a bit less shall we say assertive. This is a small thing indeed and generally our experience was quite positive and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of sneaky charges!”
Reviews.Author: din222
Reviews.Content: What a disappointment! We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights while visiting Seattle a week ago. It was our first time in Seattle and we picked this hotel based on its location and the reviews that we had read. First off, the rooms are a lot smaller than what we are used to, but it's clean and comfortably decorated. Second of all, they keep charging us for things that we did not consume! We got a charge for a bottle of water that we did not drink. I already found it strange when we went back to the hotel after housekeeping came in the second day, we found an extra bottle of water by our night stand. We didn't think much of it since the seal is still intact, so we just left it where we found it. When we checked out the next morning, there was a charge of almost $4 for that bottle of water. After I explained it to them, they did take it off. As I was going through my credit card statement after we got home, I noticed there was another charge of $5.48 from the hotel. I called and asked and was told that was for a bag of m&ms and a snickers bar, which again we did not have!!!!!! Please beware of your bill and check closely if you do decide to stay at this hotel. One more thing, free wifi is only limited to the lobby area and parking is $49/day.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: ptbooth
Reviews.Content: Overall, a great stay at the Hotel Andra during our long weekend visit to Seattle. Great location within walking distance to Pike Place Market and downtown shopping in general. Steps from all the restaurants (including many of the Tom Douglas empire). Only a slightly longer walk (15-20 min) to the Space Needle/Seattle Center, ferry terminals, and to Capitol Hill. I loved the decor of the rooms, very modern and stylish. Space was good with a sitting area with couch. Our room had a view from the back of the hotel of the Space Needle. The only negatives of the stay: pricey parking ($39/night, which I guess is standard for downtown Seattle hotels), the toilet was wedged into the bathroom such that the toilet paper dispenser is basically in your lap (at least in our room, I don't know if all rooms have the same setup), and the bed was a little soft for my partner (fine for me). Also, smelling the aroma of roasting lamb (or whatever was being prpared in the restaurant Lola connected to the lobby) every evening could be annoying to some.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best best hotels”
Reviews.Author: shmoshy
Reviews.Content: All too often people are quick to write a review about some horrible experience they had at a hotel or restaurant and quite often forget to write about the exceptional experiences they have had. I will admit that I am guilty of this myself. I don't often write reviews However After staying at the Hotel Andra and I felt it necessary to tell people how truly wonderful it is there. The rooms were beautifully decorated and the location was wonderful. What made the hotel standout even more though was how wonderful the staff was. The staff were always friendly and attentive and always went above and beyond to assist you in any way possible. Staying at the Hotel Andra is just one more thing to look forward to on my next trip to Seattle

Reviews.Title: “Picture Perfect”
Reviews.Author: AggieJoe80
Reviews.Content: Hotel Andra greatly exceeded our expectations. I did extensive research on trip advisior and other sites prior to booking this hotel. I know that there are opinions that are skewed at both ends of the spectrum and I account for that. I can truely say that this was one of the finest hotels that we have stayed in. The room was spotless and well appointed and the staff was always eager to help. The location was great and just a short walk to Pike Place Market. You would do well to dine at their restaurants as well. I am probably the worlds pickest eater and I was extremely satisfied with the food. We dined at Serious Pie, Lola's and Dahlia's and all were great.

Reviews.Title: “Good Design, Good Location, Good Staff = Andra”
Reviews.Author: Canadatom1
Reviews.Content: We were extremely pleased with our room selection at the Hotel Andra. It had many design elements that work very well: couch positioned in front of a double window makes for a comfy spot with natural light, walk-in closet almost as big as some hotel rooms, ample drawers and shelves for storage, night-light in the bathroom to guide your path & bags of ice on each floor located in front of the elevator. These are not revolutionary but all make for a stay with advanced comfort (contrast with those beautiful minimalist rooms with absolutely no where to place a toothbrush). The hotel is ideally located for the popular tourist destination of Pike Place Market, downtown shopping & most importantly restaurants and lounges. If you want the fine dining of Dahlia Lounge (across the street), the Mediterranean flavours of Lola (in the hotel) or the dive bar charm of Shorty's Coney Island (2 blocks away) this is the location for you. Finally, we were extremely well treated by the staff. The front desk was warm and accommodating, Alexa at Lola's provided us with her dining and cocktail tips and Mary at the concierge's desk looked after all our bookings with finesse.

Reviews.Title: “Seattle boutique Hotel delight!”
Reviews.Author: JuniperLane
Reviews.Content: We love staying at Hotel Andra whenever we are in Seattle. It is in a great location for downtown shopping and concerts at the Moore & Paramount Theaters. Pike Place market is just a few blocks away as well as many fabulous restaurants and bars. Speaking of restaurants it has THREE Tom Douglas restaurants close by. Our favorite breakfast is at Lola's which is in the Hotel....you can have it sent to you if you don't feel like leaving your super comfortable room. The beds and linens are amazing, I sleep so well every time I am there. The staff is always courteous and welcoming. I really appreciate an independent hotel with the attention to detail like Hotel Andra.....in an industry that is often homogenized this is a welcomed departure from the norm!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bluzjoint
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel for the reviews and location near Pike Place. To our surprise, everything about Hotel Andra exceeded our expectations. The hotel staff from bell services to afternoon tea service was extremely personable, helpful, attentive, professional and friendly. The interior of both the lobby and hotel room looked fantastic for an older building remodeled to currently styles. Both the bed and the sofa bed were comfortable. Our only complaint was how our room was located at the end of the hallway near the room service elevator. We did hear a lot of hotel service foot traffic just outside our door. Would definitely stay again as there is more shopping and eating to do in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “A Northwest Gem!”
Reviews.Author: VatoTucson
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have traveled all over the world, but never have we been so pleasantly surprised by what was waiting for us when we checked into the Hotel Andra! Completely RETRO furnished rooms with warm and inviting colors. Very comfortable bed. No road/city noise. Handwritten note from management. Best italian Reataurant we have been to in years right next door. Had a perfectly prepared breakfast in the Hotel's restaurant called Lola's. There right, whatever Lola wants - Lola gets and that was a big tip for a well trained and friendly staff to go with the fresh high quality meal. Did I say the the room cost was very modest? Dan & Tina Chambers

Reviews.Title: “Waste of money”
Reviews.Author: Anitria
Reviews.Content: Seriously the room quality and service quality did not represent 5 star expectations. Especially for the price. I saved more money flying to a 5 star hotel in las Vegas where they cater to all of your needs and wants.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean hotel with friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: desertliesel
Reviews.Content: Beginning with making the reservations, the hotel Andra staff was responsive and easy to work with. They answered all our questions and assisted us with travel arrangements to and from the airport; to and from a different hotel where our conference was being held; and with finding a place for dinner! The hotel was conveniently located close to shopping (including a Ralph's grocery store), the water front, and restaurants. Our rooms were clean and spacious and had everything we needed. I would definitely stay there again and refer my friends! Thank you for everything!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Property-a hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: MapleValley_WAFred
Reviews.Content: Perfect location. Great restaurants adjacent. Excellent staff

Reviews.Title: “5 star hotel- Great service, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: NittanyAgent
Reviews.Content: This is probably one of the best hotels I've ever been in, service wise. The rooms were modern, excellent concierge, and great location. Excellent modern decor, with a comfy bed and great pillows. Phenomenal room setting and snap your fingers service. I requested a bottle opener, and within 2 minutes someone was at my door. I had a problem with my phone, and instantly they fixed it. My fiance and I went out to dinner after the concierge reserved a table for us, and they sent an appetizer in complimentary from the hotel. Its these little things that really up a service rating in my book. I recommend it to anybody that's staying in Seattle. A few blocks away from Pike Market and excellent restaurants. The only downfall would be the modern showers. It was one of those showers that was just built into the floor, and the shower curtain didn't go all the way down, so some water would spill into the bathroom floor. Really not terrible though. Excellent

Reviews.Title: “One of the Northwest's Best”
Reviews.Author: maenee1
Reviews.Content: The whole experience was wonderful. We were made to feel welcome, the service was great, the room, a suite, was very tastefully furnished and well equipped. Everything was clean, the bed very comfortable and the bedding was great. It is at the top of my list for a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable splendor.”
Reviews.Author: GSharpMajor
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Seattle. The king sized bed was comfortable and the pillows were perfect. We loved the location of the hotel. It was an easy train ride to and from the airport, MUCH cheaper than a taxi and a 5 min walk from the station to the hotel door in the downtown area. Bring comfortable walking shoes and getting around the city is a breeze. Pike Place Market is about a ten minute walk downhill. Lots of interesting stores I've never seen in NYC on the avenues and side streets from 1st Ave to 4th Ave. Pick up a free bus Metro Map of the tourist stops at the Westlake train Station (which is where you get off to get to the Hotel Andra) to get the bus routes that will get you to where you want to go. Highly recommend the Ballard neighborhood. The only demerit goes to the room's air conditioner. Its compressor was annoyingly loud, but we were so tuckered out from walking all over town, we slept like babies. We had asked for a high, quiet floor. Do not miss the triple cream coconut pie at Dahlia's Lounge across the street!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: k2rm
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a modern fashionable, vibe, but remains relaxing, comfortable and friendly. The rooms are spacious and (most importantly) quiet and comfortable. I really can't say enough good things about the staff and management - they really take that extra effort to make sure you have everything you need to make your stay relaxing and comfortable. The hotel staff was, without exception, friendly, courteous and efficient, particularly the bellmen and the valets - very attentive, friendly and prompt. I have stayed in many world class hotels, including the Fairmont Olympic, but frankly, the Andra (and sister hotel, Mondera, in Portland) are really something special. Oh, and don't forget Lola next door! Order the doughnuts with marscapone and house-made preserves.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and location!”
Reviews.Author: Consultant57
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Seattle and I was traveling alone after a conference in Portland, Or. I found the hotel's location perfect for my purposes...very close to shopping areas and main attractions yet in a quiet, neighborhood section. The hotel's decor was understated elegance, comfortable, and very clean. The staff was excellent, always helpful and polite. One staff member, Mary, who was at the front desk and concierge desk went out of her way to be thoughtful and considerate. How nice to have someone remember your name and ask how your day's adventure went when you returned in the evening. Finally, what I loved was the mix of guests staying there at that time from families with young children to couples of all ages. I wouldn't want to stay anywhere else next time I return to Seattle. I

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: johnsuzy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent one night at the Hotel Andra. We enjoyed every second of our stay from the time that we were greated by the friendly Valet until we checkedout the next day. The room was nicely laid out and clean. The flat screen was nice. The shower had a nice dispenser for the shampoo and soap. There were 2 very soft robes. A small fridgerator was stocked with water, soda, and beer if you liked. We brought our own drinks and used the fridge. We had a drink in the nice quiet lounge adjacent to the resurant. We left our car there while we walked to the Mariners game. They stored our bags until we got back. The staff was very pleasant. I'm not sure how they remebered our names. That was a nice touch. I will definately stay here again. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: randbcraib
Reviews.Content: We started our vacation in US with a four night stay in the Andra. We really could not fault anything, from the warm and courteous staff to the size and comfort of the rooms we were very happy. The position is ideal for walking to all attractions and we loved having breakfast or late night snacks in Ralph's deli across the road where we picked up free wireless access.We enjoyed one meal in Lola's restaurant which was very good.We took a taxi from the airport as we had had such a long journey but the airport transport bus stops outside the Warwick only 50 metres away. We were hiring a car to leave Seattle at the end of our stay and the Avis office is only a short walk away on 5th Avenue which was very easily accessed.All in all a great start to our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it but not sure if we would spend the money again.”
Reviews.Author: KfromLongIsland
Reviews.Content: We loved the location of the Andra-it was central to everything in Seattle and in what appeared to be the safest part of town. The rooms were well appointed with a modern but homey décor, and the bed was incredibly comfortable. Our room had a beautiful view of Space Needle. In spite of the fact that I loved returning to the soothing atmosphere of the lobby and room every day, I’m not sure if I would spend the money to stay there again. There were too many down sides for us. The A/C was VERY loud, waking me up with almost every click on/off. The room was TINY- maybe 9x9, and full of furniture (a bar, a desk and two end tables), with no place to unpack clothes other than a closet. It was tough to negotiate having two suitcases in such a small space. The BIG turn off came when I attempted to arrange a taxi to take me to airport. I was told (by two different front desk workers, at two different times) that they could arrange a Town Car for me for only $40. I refused explaining that a taxi is cheaper and they actually disagreed, although the $32 fare is clearly visible on all taxi doors. I have the money to spend but don’t appreciate being ripped off. Since it was our first trip to Seattle, I am happy we stayed there but now that we know the lay of the land, we will probably stay elsewhere when we return.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is Without doubt the best of...”
Reviews.Author: PandoraDave
Reviews.Content: This hotel is Without doubt the best of all the hotels we stayed in on our trip from San Francisco to Seattle. The rooms are fantastic. We had a suite, room 705, which looked just like it hadn't been used. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: PMT33
Reviews.Content: Good bed with comfortable linens. Large room with desk, large tv, sofa, coffee table, and huge closet. Low light in the bathroom. Enjoyed the huge mirror in the room. Overall very good experience. When I walked in, never greeted by front desk, which wasn't very professional; they were always talking to each other. The air conditioning/heating system was VERY loud. You had to pay for wifi/internet access, which seems very antiquated and stingy. And you had to fight a little for the hot water. There was a pathetic business center. And they lost my breakfast room service reservation that I stuck to my door the night before, which was very inconvenient as I was in a rush. Even considering that, of my three-night stay, I would much prefer to stay there than anywhere else in Seattle. I enjoyed my experience, every though I thought I deserved a bit more respect, professionalism, and service from a boutique hotel. I would stay there again over a Sheraton or Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: FinlayTP
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Staff is always professional and friendly. Rooms are always perfect. Comfy beds. Room service food is great. Lola, a Tom Douglas restaurant that is in the hotel, is always wonderful and open early and late.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Rooms are the best”
Reviews.Author: JRCZAR
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Andra six nights in June; First the rooms are large with great bathrooms ours faced 4th Street but was very quiet. Nice touches; ice in bags at the elevator ready to take to your room as you exist the elevator. Many great restaurants within 5 min. walking. Also the new airport transit $1.25 per senior adult, takes 30 minutes, no traffic problems; this service at the Monorail station, take elevator to the LL below street level, very helpful people in using this service, is only 3 blocks from the Hotel. Stay here if can get a room. Staff is superb. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Seattle Sophistication”
Reviews.Author: Namenotalreadychosen
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at Hotel Andra and found it to be flawless in every regard, from the front reception to housekeeping and Room Service. I looked forward to coming back to the hotel at the end of the day to be greeting warmly by staff, find my bed turned down and some light jazz playing in the background. The gourmet food selection was excellent as part of the mini-bar selection and coffee making facilities were available. Every whim was catered for...hair-dryer, in-room safe, luggage racks and newspaper delivered daily. My husband called from Australia several times over the week and found the staff to be friendly and helpful. I shared a meal with a colleague at Lola, which again was really enjoyable. She stated that my lovely spacious room was much nicer than her accommodation on the Waterfront! Within close proximity to all major attractions and most importantly, the shopping district. As you can see, I can highly recommend Hotel Andra and hope to have the pleasure of staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “What a great weekend with my girlfriends!”
Reviews.Author: Julesb90
Reviews.Content: Recently when attending a concert at Key Arena, my girlfriends and I stayed at Hotel Andra and we were very impressed! The staff at the hotel was great and the room was awesome. The beds were very comfortable and the room was very nicely decorated.
